text: On tap at the Fat Heads Brewery & Saloon. Tropical aromas, pineapple. Clear orange with a mostly lasting white head. Juicy, fruity, yellow. Medium bodied.

Pours an orange-yellow with little white head. 

Beautiful citrus favor; bursts of grapefruit with lime and orange not far behind. Slight malt that perfectly compliments the intense, hoppy profile of this fantastic IPA. 

Would order again, and again.. and again.... aaand again. 

Refreshing, diverse, genius.
Draft in the Philly Airport. Fruity and juicy nose, with apricot, orange, cream, spearmint, resin, pine. Bitter, fresh, juicy finish. About as good as an IPA gets these days.
Ohio, good. Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This IPA is spot on. Nose is clear American hops. Taste is sweet and hoppy hop candy with minimal bitterness. Perect body. Really an excellent. IPA.

Growler from Trenton Road Takeout in Falsington, PA. Bright Amber gold topped by a small frothy beige head. Fragrant citrus hop nose explodes on the pour. Wonderful buttery, toasted malt flavor upfront. Then comes the rush of citrus and pine hops. Bitter, yet not over done. Complex and spicy with notes of mango, pineapple and tangerine. Finish becomes peppery with pine and grapefruit notes. Just a splendid example of a West Coast style IPA. Worth seeking out.

Poured into a pint glass from a growler. Hoppy nose, white head, light brown/golden hue, and cobweb lacing. Incredible hop taste that is both citrus and dank, earthy herb. One of the best; in my upper tier with Bells Two-Hearted and Stone IPA. A good deal at Pinnochios in Media, PA. Cheers!
Draft at Winking Lizard Macedonia. Not much aroma Deep golden straw in color. Taste the hops not over whelming. Carbonated on the palate and above average for the style.

12 oz bottle poured, sent over by Pruf. Thanks! Always fun to try a top 50 IPA. A mostly clear golden pour. Aromatic hop quality from quite a distance. Flavor is a bitter piney constant, flavorful, and very tasty. Thicker body to this. Cool late, and the flavor turns a little more to the citrus side as it lingers. A juicy side to it as well. A solid IPA here for sure. Id love to be able to throw a pint of this down regularly. Awesome.

Draft at the Industry. Clear body, medium golden, soft fluffy head. . Pretty gentle, but wonderful malt profile. Fairly smooth throughout, despite its claim of being aggressive. Pretty lavorful, nice feel.

Pours clear golden amber with a fat and foamy off white head that has staying power. Aroma is fruity citrus hop with just a touch of fresh pine. Taste is balls to the wall citrus from sweeter pineapple to lasting bitter grapefruit. Piney bitter hop close. This is a great IPA.

Dourada translúcida, espuma amarelada de ótima formação e boa persistência. Aroma mais forte de frutas amarelas maduras, abacaxi, lúpulo cavalar, resinosa. Amargor médio/intenso, médio dulçor. Corpo e carbonatação médios. Final mantém as impressões do aroma com frutas maduras e resina que gruda na língua. Deliciosa.

Appearance: Hazy deep honey amber. Thin head of tiny white bubbles.
Nose: Sweet citrus, grapefruit and a touch of pine hops with medium roasted malt.
Taste: A juicy blend of citrus and tropical fruit hops over a sweeter candy malt.
Body: Light side of medium and lively.
Parting thoughts: A very nice tropical hop showcase IPA.
Smell of hop, sweet floral, grapefruit. Drink from bottle, cant see color. Well balanced ipa with right bitterness, smooth. Hopilicious. Right texture. Very good Ohio IPA. Will drink again.

Orange copper colour with a fast disappearing off white head. Smells very resinous and floral. Very piney IPA, tons of hop flavour and medium bitterness, very punchy, medium bodied and oily. Hop flavour for miles, this is a VERY good IPA!

poured from portland brewpubs draft. balanced aromas and flavors of citrus, pine, and just great depth. just enough resinous character to make it interesting. just enough bite to know its an IPA. drinks well and easy to ask for another.

From 12 oz bottle. Served in curved pint glass. Clear golden color with a thin white head. Very little lacing. A good solid pine like aroma. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Solid notes of pine and citrus. Light to medium bodied beer. Average carbonation. Over all a very tasty and enjoyable IPA. Beer is well balanced between sweet and bitter.

Very good super piney and chewy IPA. Maybe a tad overhyped or it was, but definitely worth a shot for the
Hop crazed individual. Bitterness well balanced with minimal sweetness. Solid!!!

On tap at Falling Rock Tap House. Clear bronze appearance with active carbonation and a fluffy beige head with excellent retention, eventually lacing the glass. Aroma of piney hops, floral notes, citrus zest and light hop resin. Similar flavor, adding medium to heavy bitterness. Medium body with a light dry feel and a lingering hop finish. Good, but not great.

Pours hazy orange-gold with a 3-finger off-white head. Resiny and piney hops aromas, maybe some caramel malt underneath. Body is medium and a bit oily. Just a touch of astringency to the finish. Flavors of citrus and piney hops, with a note of resin as it warms.
Tap. Pineapple fruit aroma. Mildly sweet with tropical hop flavor and fairly strong bitter finish. Medium body.
This is a truly great beer. Pour is amber with a creamy cream colored head. Aroma is earthy hops and happy. This beer show the east is able to run with the west.

12 ounce bottle for is a light copper color with a medium off White head. Nice hop aroma of citrus and pineapple. High-level of carbonation. Nice sharp hop bitterness with some bite to it. Light bodied.

Smokin Joes Pittsburgh bottle: pours light orange with a white head. Aroma is grapefruit and tropical fruits... Basically very west coast. Bitter and dry with loads of citrus. At 87 ibu it is not overly brutal. Still quite bitter. Quite good but not quite a hundred hundred.
Tap. Full bodied IPA. Light citrus and pine. Decent malt sweetness. Well balanced although the hops dont really pop like i would want them to.

Pours an orange copper with a white head. Nose is citrus, candied orange, apricot, ruby red grapefruit, sweet malt. Taste is big and yummy. Candied orange, citrus, light caramel sweetness, fruit. Yummy

BOTTLED ON 07/05/16. Nose strong paper with grapefruit, lemon, orange, lots of rind and some pine; pour clear orange-golden with a foamy off-white head. Taste very dry and strongly bitter though the hints of sweetness from the hops save it from brutality, crisp with citrus rind and heavy resin, spice; sunny with light alcohol showing, touch jammy, light-medium malt as insufficient support but not too bad, lightly airy and definitely oily medium-full body (makes me a touch queasy, to be honest). Some very nice, bold flavors here, but missing on some aspects and a little heavy and non-refreshing for the big points. [2016.08.04: 3.5]

Pours a hazy honey color with a pillowy white head which lingers and laces......aroma of tropical fruits, grapefruit, melon......taste is a touch thin, but seems to thicken on the back end as it warms slightly, melon, mild bitterness, grapefruit, touch peppery with a nice citrus finish. Wow.
Poured a rich orange color with a thick white head. Huge citrus hop aroma. Very fruity and fresh on the nose. Nice sweetness on the tongue. Tremendous IPA!

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 6/7/2016. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow color with a nice 2 finger dense off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around the glass. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of huge grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, pine, light caramel, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of dank citrus/tropical/pine hops and light-moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, pine, light caramel, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Large amount of pine/citrus rind bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, lemon/orange rind, pine, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish with a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dank citrus/tropical/pine hops and light-moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and minimal astringent hop flavors lingering after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness, that increases through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, sticky/resinous, and lightly creamy/grainy mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an insane IPA as expected. All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dank citrus/tropical/pine hops and light-moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink for the ABV. An insanely amazing offering all around.

Bottle. Pours golden amber with off-white had. Aroma is sweet fruity orange grapefruit piney. Taste is Taste is sweet malty hoppy with a piney grapefruit finish. Very well balanced with hoppy finish and good, however my preference is the less malty IPAs.

12 oz bottle. pours a nice amber color. smell is very nice and hoppy. taste is excellent. smooth and hoppy. very close to being as good as any IPA Ive had. Like them a tiny bit more hoppy and citrusy. definitely worth a purchase if you can get your hands on it

Pours dark gold into a shaker. Off white head with excellent retention recedes to coat surface. Pine and citrus aromas. Sweet hot resin and grapefruit upfront turning to mild sourdough before the lastin pith finish.
Pours a clear medium amber with a medium head of white foam. Nice citrus and pine aroma. Flavor is fairly good and somewhat sweet with just a hint of bitterness. Not too harsh. Good but not great.

4 oz pour on draft at City Tap House during the SAVOR Week event. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, floral notes, light malt. Tastes of citrus, floral notes, pine, malt. Medium body with a dry finish.
Lots of citrus in this and a very nice malt backbone. Bitter finish. Bigger body here than most of the other hop bombs Ive had tonight. Good, but certainly not a 100/100 beer. Tap at city tap house.

Bottle pour..bottled 5.13..super fresh..pours a dipa like medium orange with 1 finger creamy head..nose is crazy good bursting with citrus..getting a nice combo of honeydew melon, cantaloupe n grapefruit..light to medium bodied..grapefruit comes through more on taste..hop hit is good from start to finish..pine character more evident in mouthfeel..solid combo of citrus n pine..coats palate with hoppy goodness and excellent bitterness to round out the equation..very tasty ipa
Super solid ipa. Very fresh tasting with solid balance. Its got the whole double ipa hops without the double ipa commitment to being hungover via 13% behemoth beer. I like it a lot.

2015 BJCP Category: 21A American IPA
AROMA: Fairly strong aroma of citrus and melon. Clean, bright scent with slight tea leaves or pine needles. 10/12APPEARANCE: Orange proper hue; quite cloudy but carbonation is visible. Average, off-white, foamy head. Good retention and lacing. 2/3FLAVOR: Intense dank bitterness. Delectable combination of fruit juice concentrate, bitter citrus pith and some pine/green tea on the finish. Malt is strong enough to offer balance, but is not sweet or distinguishable. 17/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium body; crisp and well carbonated. Alcohol is subtle and slightly warming but tolerable. Dry, slightly astringent aftertaste. 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: A standard IPA that goes above and beyond. Pours a nice deep amber color. Aromas of hops/hops/citrus. Strong hop flavors with malts and a peppery crisp dry finish.

Bottle shared by Maakun. Almost clear golden with white head. Thick pine resin with fruity notes, citrus, pineapple, rye-ish, spicy, some marijuana-like hoppiness. Over medium sweet, medium bitter. Full body, oily, resiny, almost honey-like. Lower than average carbonation.

Bottle shared, thanks to jtclockwork for the trade! Clear orange golden with white head. Some pine needles and resin, thick sweet sugary malts, mango, toffee, caramel, pineapple. Medium sweet and bitter. Over medium bodied with nice syrupy feel.

Pours copper-orange with a one finger off white head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of fresh citrus juice, tropical fruits, peach, grassy hops, light dankness, and light bready malts. Taste is similar to the aroma with maybe just a little sweet malt note in the background. Has medium-full body with a creamy mouthfeel and a pretty bitter, long, lingering finish. Overall, a fantastic, world class IPA that Im glad I stumbled upon.
@ Fat Heads 16-3-10: En mycket trevlig humlig ipa med fina toner av gräs och ananas samt passion.
From a tap at the pdx brewery location. The pour is a hazy dark orange with a white head. A oily grapefruit and mango ipa
On tap at the Brewpub in Portland. Golden/orange with a white head. Fresh and hoppy with grapefruit and some pineapple. Also some hay.
A mellow and thick IPA. It comes with a mild bitterness, nutty backbone and a dash of acetone. Nothing to write home about. Unlike the double...

Bottle from Craigs, dregs run. Pours hazy gold with a thin white head. Aromas are a citrus party, light caramel. Taste is bitter, pithy. Bitter, light sweet and a little thin on the finish. Solid ipa action.

Pale slightly hazy golden, puffy white ringed head. Nose is rich piney lime, gummy passionfruit. Initial taste is a rich dewy floral pine, gritty oily bitterness. Carbonation is solid and mouthfeel is creamy and vibrant. Finishes steely bitter, crisp and piney with a rich sweetshop dryness.Bottle fae Garvie Florweda, Pig Out Tasting.
Bottle at Garvies. Pours clear golden yellow with a medium white head which recedes. Aroma is pine, grassy, caramel. Taste is bitter grassy, peach, earthy, piney, mango sweet. Medium-high bitter.
Bottle at craigs. Pours clear golden, nose is sweet toffee and grapefruit, taste is similar, salty, dry.
Dark orange. A bitter, carbonated initial taste that ends sweeter. Lemon, orange, herb.

A golden ipa with a thick creamy off white head. In aroma, nice caramel malt with light butterscotch, grassy hops, OK. In mouth, a sweet caramel malt with light butterscotch notes, grassy resinous hops, OK. On tap at Local Tavern, PHL.
Appearance is small white head with clear amber. Aroma is hoppy. Taste is bitter, earthy hops. Overall a pretty solid IPA.

Excellent beer overall. Aroma is good. Flavor and bitterness is amazing. Refreshing. Frutty touches. Personally i'm a IPA lover and this is top of the line

BOD 8/24/15. Clear copper pour. Outstanding head volume, world class lacing and retention.

Outstanding nose of classic pine and grapefruit rind over biscuit. As it warms subtle orange and dank notes are added.

Almost medium body that is quite smooth in texture and has creamy and oily aspects. World class carbonation with a burst of effervescence in the middle and a finely bubbled rollicking prickly finish.

The flavor profile is world class. Intense hop flavor in the west coast style that is balanced by a bready biscuit with a moderate bitterness sums this one up. It begins with an assault of pine and grapefruit rind hop flavor that slowly transitions to orange and mango as the biscuit sweetness arrives coupled with a touch of caramel. The middle delivers a moderate bitterness that adds a dank quality as it begins to fade. Alcohol is very well covered with just a hint of astringency emerging in the dry finish. A subtle bitterness lingers, but the main component is wonderful rind and dank flavor over a sweet background.

Rating #1627 - #CBC2015 Beer 12 - Welcome Reception - Pours a golden amber with a creamy white foam. Aroma of grapefruit rind, pinecone. Palate is more sweet citrus, orange, grapefruit, with a lovely piney note that finishes with assertive bitterness. Lovely IPA.
Pours an amber color with a white head. Aroma its pretty strong pic the citrus hops and caramel malts. Flavor is well balanced with the Curtis and caramel malts. Decent bitter finish.
on tap at Hulmeville Inn - hoppy grapefruity aroma and flavor. Pale golden in color. Excellent IPA.

My Bottom Line:
This quintessential American IPA develops plenty of flowers, citrus fruit and pine on a honey-laced cereal base balanced out by resinous bitterness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A foam tuft tops the bright pale amber.
-Pineapple fruitiness is also quite engaging.
-Malts share a few biscuity angles as well.
-This one is not reinventing the wheel. But it is a beautifully designed and efficient example.

Bottles.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with small white head. Nose and taste is citrus and pineapple. Nice sweetness in the aftertaste.

Bottle at home while visiting Jacksonville. Pours gold with a white head. Lovely fruity, dank hoppiness, light veg aroma. Medium body, medium carbonation. Pine, lemon, grapefruit, light mango, light toast, tangerine, light caramel, very light metal in the bitter finish. Good stuff.

Draft at Moriartys. Slightly hazy orange amber pour with a frothy off-white head. Complex mix of dry hops. Earthy citrus resins. Medium blonde caramel malts but the hops are rugged enough to overcome the sugars. Notes of burnt grapefruit. Spruce pinecones. Candied orange peels. Autumn leaves. Mangos. Celery stalks. Nicely full-bodied. A great IPA. Feels larger and harsher than the listed 7.5% ABV but kudos for keeping it untamed.
Pours a clear copper color with some nice lacing as well. Smells bright and hoppy. One of the better aromas that I have smelled. Tastes hoppy, bitter and floral. Love this beer!!!!

Pours a slightly hazy, bright golden orange color with lighter golden yellow edges and a half finger, white foam head that quickly settles into a thin, lasting ring. Streaks of spotty lacing left behind. 

Dank floral hop aroma with a boat load of citrus and tropical fruit notes followed by pale biscuit malt. Earthy with some grass and pine needle followed by grapefruit, pineapple, mango and blood orange. The nose has a nice balance of resinous oils, earthy grass, citrus fruit and pale malt. 

Fuller bodied than expected with stronger hop bitterness than the aroma suggests. Theres a blast of dank, earthy hop resins up front with sticky grass, pine needle and spruce tip flavors. Nice amount of dry bitterness that lingers over the sweeter notes and pale malt into a bone dry finish. Floral and perfume like at first followed by tropical and citrus fruit sweetness. This isnt as strong as in the nose but nicely balances things out with some pineapple, grapefruit and orange zest. Pale malt backbone adds balance without hindering the hop flavor. Some bread and a decent amount of biscuit-like flavor. Clean, crisp and pretty easy to drink but the bitterness could be balanced a little more by the sweeter fruit notes. Still, this is a very good beer that I could session for long periods of time.

Rated on 6-27-2015 at S & V Liquors, Fort Wayne, IN event. This bottled beer is presented with a small beige head, amber body, fast rising carbonation, and no lacing. The aroma is citrus, pine hops, grapefruit, earthy, and malty. The flavor is very bitter, citrus, pine hops, earthy, and it has a semi-dry finish. The mouthfeel is moderate carbonation and this IPA is medium bodied. This beer is very quaffable, quite bitter and it is a beer for hop heads. It is worth trying and a beer that I would partake in again.

On tap @ Fat Heads PDX. Pours slightly hazy golden with thin white head. Aroma is light caramel malt, big dank vegetal hops. Taste is crisp clean malt, big syrupy sweetness, heavy bitterness on the back. Earthy, dank, herbal, dark citrus flavors stand out here. My first Fat Heads beer, lots to like here.

12 oz. bottle from Jungle Jims International Market, Fairfield, OH (bottled September 24, 2015). Dark orange pour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit and fresh pine. Assertive hop bitterness of grapefruit rind, pine needles, fresh cut grass, and pineapple, Lingering bitterness. Among the best IPAs I have ever tried. Outstanding!

Pours a hazy dark golden color. Very thin white head with no lacing. Chunks floating that look like pulp. Hop aroma grapefruit and a flowery aroma. Lots of grapefruit to start, grassy, celery and pith in the finish.

bottle poured into a snifter..golden with a fluffy white head..aroma of citrus,pine,florals,biscuts..tastes of graperfuit,orange peel,pine and florals..
medium bodied..very good.

IPA.

On tap at the Portland brewpub - Pours clear copper with an off white head. The aroma has grapefruit, pine and toasty malt. It has a medium / full abrasive body with mild rough carbonation. The flavor starts with heavy grapefruit, dry toasted malt, crackers and pine. The finish is resiny with grapefruit zest. Very nice IPA.
Bottle. Golden pour, medium white head. Biscuit. Citrus. Dry. Toasty. Fruit. Bitter. Good. Fuck yeah. Cleveland fuckin ROCKS!
Clear darker yellow, lacing white foam head. Nice hoppy aroma and good bitter taste, good IPA. Citrus notes. (Cleveland 201510)

Bottle thanks to Jsquire! Hazy bright orange with largish foamy off-white head, floral hops aroma, medium carbonation, sweet start turning into a piney hops taste, long floral finish. Very flavorful and satisfying.

Drinkable and well balanced IPA with low carbonation. Definitely lives up to the hype. Flavorful hop presence without being over powering. Leaves a beautiful lacing in the glass, if you care about things like that? Good stuff!
Tap at Pittsburgh apt Symon bar. Gold with white lacing head. Citrus nose. Hop bite, nice balance with malt and dry astringent finish. Nice WC IPA.
Beautiful aroma of pine, citrus, grass clippings. Appearance is amber gold with a minimal head. Palate is close to perfection. Really solid IPA. Ive had this before but just havent rated it.
Tap @ Pittsburgh South. Orangey golden with decent head and lacing. Nice and grapefruity with a little pine & peachiness.. Nice & bitter & dry.
On tap at the Pint Room. Hazy yellow pour with a white head. A good amount of piney hops in the taste and aroma. Solidly bitter finish

Pours a beautiful, fluffy big head, with a vibrant yellow-amber color.

Smells irresistable lemony, very juicy, coated up by toffeeish, balancing malts. Citrus mingles together with dried orange peel outstandingly well, creating a crisp, lemon defined hoppy nose. 

Has a medium carbonation with an extremely crisp and dry, refreshing mouthfeel. 

Taste mirrors the nose, as it begins with toasty, biscuity malts, as well as bitter, luscious lemons hitting the palate in an uncompromising, fruity fashion. The beers intense lemony hop profile gets enhanced by a mineralic bubbly carbonation, revealing a grassy dryness. This dryness leads to the brews finish, in which the profound lemon character even gets enhanced by a prominent, bitter, lime infused dry note as well as slick sweeter malts, unleashing a very focused lemon fruitiness. 

Easy drinking ipa with a great hoppiness to it, gently balanced by sweeter, flavorwise fitting malts, leaving the beers spotlight on the fruity hops flavors.

This was at the Portland, OR pub at the RBSG. Poured orange with a big white head. Nose of tropical fruit and citrus. Medium body and and a resinous mouth feel. Flavor is a blast of tropical fruit with lots of the citrus. Finish is very much tasty hops. Great beer. I loved this one.

Tap at Mad Mex, Monroeville, Pa. Ordered alongside a brew dog Citra ipa. Server may have mixed up the drinks. Pours golden orange, creamy white head. Aroma is of tropical fruits, tangerine, candied orange, fairly citrusy. Flavor is hop forward, orange, lemon, some mild caramel malt. Solid.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear dark gold color with a thin white head that settles to a film leaving some lacing. Plenty of carbonation rising. Aroma I of strong citrus and a little malt in the background. Medium body, taste is of malt and citrus hops which are in the front. Slightly dry finish, the grapefruit hops linger after the swallow. Theyre doing this right!
Cloudy yellow pour with bright citrus and pine notes. Bitter with a great malt backbone and bitter finish. Very well blended.

Best combination of hops and malt ever. Cant get over the citrusy hoppiness! I prefer the draft version for fuller flavor. Uncivilized and aggressive doesnt begin to describe the palate delight. If you drink any other beers, do them first, this beer overwhelms other beers. WOW!

Pours a light rust orange. Has a strong citrus and floral hop aroma. A nice balanced taste of citrus and florla hops, pine, light fruit, caramel and malts. A balanced aftertaste of bitter citrus hops and sweet malts.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015  Pours a clear, classic golden color with a rich, dull white, bumpy head. Rich malty nose with a hint of citrus. Full, smooth mouth feel with a bit of carbonation on the back of the palate. The flavor has an eggy quality, some crème brûlée, some cooked honey, and pine. Im tempted to say this beer has been on the shelf too long, but it says it was bottled on April 6, 2015. Im drinking on July 9, 2015. But it seems to drastically lost its hop character.
Draft @ Funky Buddha Boca. Hazy amber, medium head. Fairly assertive, somewhat woody hop nose. Veers on dank. Lots of bitterness, but its not super bright. Has a bit chewy character.
Heavy citrus/grapefruit aroma. Transparent bubbling golden body under a tall white head. Thin feel. Hits hard with grapefruit zest and that is about all there is to this one.
Had this one near the end of World of Beer Fest, and it still wasnt very good. Too much hops and not enough pine or citrus.

On tap at fat head Portland pub. Pours out copper topped with a sand head. Nose is citrus pine hops caramel sweetness and lots of tropical fruit. Taste is amazing tropical fruit citrus pineapple mango caramel sweetness wow I love me some awsome ipa.

Draft at Fat Head PDX. RBSG. Wtf am I doing order a whole glass? This is RBSG, gotta step up my game. Next stop, man, next stop. Clear amber pour, small ring of white head. Aroma: fresh and hoppy. Pine and citrus, caramel backing is fully featured, balanced, still finishes dry. I see why this has such a following -- its full flavored, with medium+ body, smooth creamy texture. Assertively bitter but not at all harsh, framed against a lovely malt backdrop. Pretty darned tasty beer. Im no longer disappointed that I ordered a full glass.

Bottle. Pours a beautiful clear golden with white head. Aroma is so hoppy and resinous! Underneath there is a great malty body. Grapefruit, citrus, sligt grass and mandarin tang. Taste hits you as a APA with great malt profile and smote mouthfeel, then it turns super bitter and hoppy! Loads of citrus and long really bitter resinous finish. Smooth yet dry body. Some orange in there as well as grapefruit.
Copper color. Tastes of hoppy goodness with grapefruit, orange and som every dank hops. Its leans towards the double IPA style with the complex hops in this. Really drinkable.

Bottle from the T-Bois cheers Colin; hazy amber pour with a frothy off white head, aroma has tangerine and a hint of pine, taste has zesty orange, mango, some nice pine, hint of caramel, some spice, spot on IBUs in the finish.

Tap at whole foods, Pours a crisp bright citrus color. Nice white finger of head. The nose pops with Grate fruit, orange, pine, plenty of hope. The taste is classic IPA bold, bright, crisp, very west coast feel.

Been wanting to try this one for years. Glad it finally found its way my way. Orange pour with a white head. The aroma has some very nice tropical fruit notes as well as some biscuit malt. The flavor is similar. There is a great bit of pineapple and resin, as well as some biscuit. Medium bitterness. Everything about this IPA goes perfectly, making it an exceptional drinker. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Tap at brewery in Portland. Copper with small white head. Super piney citrus pine nose. Dry and very hoppy. Pine. One note but really true to that note. All in on tasty strong hop. If youre looking for a straightforward aggressive true ipa , this is a good one.

On tap at taphouse in Portland. Appearance: finger white head, clear, golden color, ok lacing. Aroma: light citrus, pine, caramel. Palate: medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish, sticky texture, dry finish. Taste: sweet caramel into a light thinness for a split second, on into full pine bitterness with light orange rind notes. Overall, very smooth, bitterness lingers a bit, but not overly. Very nice.
UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 Over all best ipa ever. Smooth with a great hop blend. Citrus and piney that complements the hops great. Smoothest iPa

Bottle share, thanks to Colin. Hazy orange, still, small foamy off-white head, sparse lacing. Aroma is mango, toffee. Body is medium, foamy, low carbonation. Taste is grapefruit, pine, caramel, light astringency, dry with a nice rouded bitterness. Pretty good. Archetypal American IPA.

Bottle split at the Bespin Cloud City W2, from an IP trade with an Ohibro, 05/05/15. 
Lightly hazed golden with a decent white cap.
Nose is a juicy hop shower, straw, citric pith, pine trace, apricot.
Taste comprises pine needle, caramel malt strokes, orange pith, light grapefruit.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi aggressive hop bitterness in the close.
Xolid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at Leightons place. Thanks to Colin for this one. Clear orange / golden coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is composed of spice pine needles, grassy hop, caramel malts, resin. Flavour is composed of light caramel, toffee malts, resin, pine hop, little burnt grass. Palate is medium bodied, sticky resin on the tongue, highish carbonation. Really drinkable all rounder. Classic old school West coast Ipa.

Thanks to Mark! Bottle is just over 5 months old so not particularly fresh. Pours a clear light amber color with a tan head. The smell is pine and citrus, some sweet fruit as well. The taste is piney and bitter initially then following that is some dry, crisp citrus with the ending being dry, and somewhat bitter. Medium - in body with about average carbonation with some prickle. My finding is that a 5 month old Head Hunter is OK but not great.

Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Colin. Pours clear orange with a frothy white head. The nose has some piney hops, jammy citrus, melon. Medium sweet flavor, lots of piney and grassy bitterness, grapefruit, rind, orange, some pale bread. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Finishes with lots of piney resin, bitter grass, ripe citrus fruits. Not bad overall.

Bottle thanks to Colin. It pours golden-amber with a medium white head. The nose is fresh, big juicy action, passion fruit, mango, fruit cocktail and candied peel. The taste is crisp, smooth bitterness, minerals, sherbet, pine needles, touch of alcohol, zesty citrus, mild caramel and a touch of toasty grass with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Drinks mighty easy. Nice stuff.

This is a pretty good IPA but Im a little surprised to log in and see that it is rated through the roof. To me it was just another IPA. Typical citrus nose and flavors, balanced with a clean enough bread malt underpinning. Well built and drinkable, no doubt, but it surely didnt stand out to me as world class, more like just another in a long line of good IPAs.

Pours a clear golden with particulate. one finger head that lingers. Heavy lacing with good retention. Aromas strong grapefruit rind, pine needles. Moderate bitterness. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. long mild bitter finish. well balanced ipa.
Garlicky, soapy, bitter astringency....all in a good way. Hops present through all moments of the experience.

Poured from bottle. Excellent aroma with hints of floral and citrus. For being "loaded" with hops it is well balanced with moderate bitterness and a surprising smoothness. Very nice, and very drinkable. Would recommend

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Shiny copper hue with a very slight haze. The head is lovely, a pillowy cap of pure white froth that sticks around for a long while. Crazy aroma -- a mix of citrusy and tropical hop notes like grapefruit, grass, mango, pineapple, maybe a bit of banana. Great balance, brilliant brightness. The flavor doesnt have as much kick, but those hop flavors are still discernible and perfectly balanced, as are the moderate bitterness and gentle honey sweetness. Very, very nice IPA.

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours golden amber with a one finger head. Aroma of pine, caramel, grass, and slight citrus. Bitter throughout the sip, slightly sweet caramel, lots of pine. Medium body, good carbonation, nice west coast style IPA.

Pours orange with decent head. Smell fresh hops. Mouthfeel light with decent carbonation. A very good hop flavor. No malts. Amazing IPA. Fav ++

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
[2/23/15] Draught at Fat Heads in Portland. Clear golden. Aroma of green hops, fruity and slightly oniony. Green hops flavor, fruity and a bit oniony, with nice bitterness. Medium-bodied. Good.
Pours a clear golden color with white head. Pine, citrus, grass, and resinous notes on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes bitter, with a nice hop bite.

From memory, on tap, darker golden hue, earthy pine smell with some hop citrus hues, more passion fruit but a great balance dry bitter and sweet malt but not overly sweet, very good worth going out of the way for
Tap, gold pour. White head, nose and taste are super bitter. Citrus, piney, great IPA

Really heavy citrus nose with a bit of pine and toffee. Clear, orange, some retention. Resinous mouthfeel, with the pine up front, then a bit of citrus and it really mellows out. Hop forward indeed. Thanks for the trade Ron.

Bottle Erica brought back from Ohio. Pours a clear orange in color with a finger of white head that leaves a small amount of lacing. Aroma has a great citrus scent, along with some floral and tropical fruit notes. Flavor is fresh citrus hops throughout. Finishes with a tangy bitterness and lingers on the palate. Alcohol is very well hidden. Delicious.

Typical American hop aroma. Great color with a thin head. Bitter up front with sine sweetness. I would have liked this beer a bit drier. Good ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Fatheads, Portland. Colour is clear light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, some grape, some pine, hops and malts.

Bottle courtesy of Paul. Pours a bright golden orange body with nice one finger soft white head. Aroma is fresh melon and light sweet fruit. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of bright fruit - mainly melon, but some pineapple as well, pine; soft sweet malt compliments the hop profile nicely. Also, reasonably drinkable as well.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 Rerate: "FRESH" Bottle - This rocks socks! Juicy, bitter, vibrant, crushable! 4.2 

Bottle: mostly clean (some floaties) golden hue with a frothy head and okay lace. Juicy, tropical, lightly spicy and touch dank hop notes over a layer of biscuity and bready malts. While it leans towards the bitter side it is not over the top and quite drinkable. Lively and aggressive mouth feel. Pretty darn tasty I must say.

Bottle. Amber body. Aggressively hopped is not an understatement; this is full of citrus and pine, biting hops throughout, with sweetness and bitterness lingering for a while after the swig. Theres no shortage of high-hopped beers these days but this ones a keeper for the hopheads. It tastes good so who cares if IPAs are cliche.

Pours golden with a thin white head. As soon as you pop the bottle a huge citrus, pineapple, grapefruit, and pine resin aroma explodes out. Flavor starts out citrus and sweet pineapple then is quickly over taken with a potent grapefruit rind and pine resin hop bitterness.
Pours a dark golden color with a white head. Light body. Extremely hop forward with citrus flavors. Lots of pine flavors during and after tasting. Not my favorite type of IPA but done very well.
Smells like a lot of grapefruit and tropical citrus. Light hopyness with a citrus flavor, backed by a light malt body. Very easy drinking IPA

Hoppy, fruity aroma. Cascade and Simcoe definitely recognizable (I think). Pineapple, grapefruit, citrus. So much fruit in an IPA. Bitter finish, medium carbonation, the perfect balance. So delicious.

Tap at shamrock. Bright yellow gold with lively carbonation that leads to a great white head that lasts. Big pine floral hop aroma. Flavor is well balanced between pine hops and sweet cracker malts. Not a beer for the hop adverse but a treasure for those who do.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden orange. Smells delicious! -- Tropical fruit, pine, pineapple; on the verge of dank. Taste to me is all about the hops, though there is a nice malt backbone that allows all of the flavor hops to shine. Medium bitterness. Medium bodied. Extremely solid IPA.
Pours amber orange. Smells really dank and fruity. Taste matches and lingers nicely for a long time

Tap at Fat Heads. Top notch IPA. Modern feel thanks to the Simcoe, and the Cascade and Columbus round it out. Filtered golden orange body. Foamy off-white head. Fresh, big hop tones. Great balance. Excellent.

On tap at 2014 GTMW, been waiting awhile to try this one, pours a hazy amber orange with a thick white head and lots of lacing, the aroma has a ton of citrus and tropical fruit on the nose, mango and pineapple over flow from the glass, the flavor has a bright hop and fruit front end with a crisp finish of citrus and fruit, mouthfeel was pretty awesome, wow.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a clear Amber with white head. Nice strong citrus aroma with a little pine. Even some tropical fruits. Taste is a nice clean consistent bitterness with a malt backbone. Moderately heavy bitterness with a mild to moderate sweetness. Flavors of grapefruit, orange, tropical fruits, pine, caramel. Definitely a top tier IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at PDX location.

A: Semi - clear orange color, whispy white head, some lacing.

N: Pineapple, biscuit, pine, toffee, some grapefruit and mango. Balanced between citrus and earth.

T: Drying bitterness, good sweetness underneath.

M: Resinous, medium body. Prickly carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden.

O: A mighty fine IPA. Great balancing act though its not any thing you havent had before. Prefer Hop Venom, but would drink this anytime.

Pours pretty golden clear, low amounts of head. Some hops and citrus in taste. An enjoyable beer.
Had on tap and from a bottle.

On tap at Fat Heads in Portland. Colour...golden-Amber with a thin head. Nose...quite tropical with dried pineapple and mango as well as star fruit. Palate...very frothy up front and then wave after wave of resinous, dusty hops and crushed pineapple. The mid palate is lightly sweet and brimming with mango and maradarin. The finish is long and bitter.
Ive had this on draft and in the bottle, both are exceptional. Very well balanced earth/citrus blend. I must admit that this brew hides the ABV quite well.
On draught at Fat Heads Portland. Golden color. Aroma is pine and bitter citrus. Hop bomb flavors, with the pine, grapefruit, and orange. Good balance of sweet malt for all the hoppiness.
Tastes like Im licking a tree. Got as a gift. Awful. Would rather get run over by a truck than consume one of these again.
Pours a Merky golden color. Nice thick foamy head. Aroma of grapefruit. Tastes is hoppy, grapefruit, crisp. Not an IPAD guy but, this is pretty good.

Found this at an ABC store in FL. Pours clear Amber with an offwhite head. Juicy hop aroma - tropical fruit. Intensely bitter with malt backing. Getting lots of that tropical fruit on the tongue. Medium body. Very nice ipa.
on tap, a very well balanced IPA, lovely fruit/hop combination, working well with the high ABV, very good american style strong pale ale

pours pale golden, reminds me of anderson valley back in the day.... citrus/culumbus a bit middle of the road...
living near jungle jims...
On tap at Barrel House in Gibsonia PA. Full flowery woodsy aroma. Hops almost harsh, resiny with lemon peel. Dry on the palate. yellow with slight orange tinge, thin white head.
Hoppy for sure. Not a lot of head on it. Dont think my palate is developed enough for the citrus and pine.
Draft in fl. Smells wonderful. Definite full IPA taste, slightly over the top aftertaste. Lots of body. Not for non IPA drinkers.. but damn good

Bottle. Pours golden orange with a small white head. Aroma was hoppy with citrus, grapefruit and pine. Flavor was sweet and bitter with citrus zest, pine, grapefruit, a bit of caramel and some orange peel. Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter dry finish.
On tap at world of beer, pensacola, FL. Amber with white head. Smell is hoppy floral and pine. Taste is heavy floral and pine hops. Dry with high bitterness and low carbonation.
12oz bottle pours a yellow Amber color with very little head. Aroma of onions, but perhaps this is just very intense pininess. The hop bitterness is intense and overpowers the rest of the brew.

This draft brew from a restaurant poured a large sized head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a very softly carbonated transparent light and an excellent lacing. The sharp aroma was citrus and hoppy. The sharp crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and strongly tingly at the finish with a lingering hoppy aftertaste. The sharp flavor contained notes of bitter semi-sweet mild nut citrus burnt malt crisp and hops. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2014 Two month bottle pours a golden yellow with a little orange hue. Just a small amount of white fizz. Nice rich aroma, grainy bright but really, herbs hoppy. There is a sweet grainy front that is nice and smooth but quickly fades into the bitter citrus peel and lightly abrasive earthy hop kick. Fairly focused on the hop character it has a steady bitterness, a moderate lingering flavor and works great with the grains. I think the grains are actually my favorite part, makes this very easy to drink.

Bottle at tasting.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, fresh.
TASTE: hoppy, dry, fruity.

"What a wonderful, fresh IPA this is! Huge and complex aroma and flavors...heavy pine, citrus, AND tropical candied fruit, like pineapple. Near perfect balance between sweet and bitter. Drinks like a double flavor-wise with a lighter drinkable palate. Among the elite. Thanks ggrumet for this masterpeice!"

Nice IPA scent, deep golden color, huge IPA taste, a bit of an IPA aftertaste, this is a great IPA and I had it after a Sam Adams Rebel IPA which is another good IPA 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle at Engine No. 9 in St Petersburg, FL. Golden orange with a decent off-white head. Aroma is of citrus, mango, pineapple, a hint of dank hops. Taste is slightly dank with notes of mango, grapefruit, light pine, caramel and grass.

355 ml. bottle sampled @ Pure Apricot Tasting. Thanks! Excited to try this one, I have heard a lot of great things about this one. Orange, little white bubbles for head. Huge cheese hops in the nose, bit odd mix malt, candy, caramel, touch dank, Taste is dank, cheese, malt, apricot, caramel, grass, fruits, Creamy body, low carb. Nice beer but not top (esp. due to a bit clashing malt & hop profile), prob. too high expectations here.
Aroma is dank hops and pine. The flavor is dank hops, grapefruit, citrus/fruit, malts, a hint of nuttiness and a long and bitter/very slight heat in the finish.

Bottle to glass. Pours a clear golden light amber color with a thin off white head. Aroma is quite distinct, funky tropical fruits, skunky. Flavor is a delicious fleshy fruit sweetness. Light to medium in body and extremely drinkable. Unique. Fantastic.

Pours a hazy dark amber with a creamy head. Healthy, fresh, traditional hop aroma. Strong hops flavor with a minimum malt back. Not overwhelming but solid. Sticky sweet aftertaste with a minimum hops linger.
Draft at Bar Symon at PIT airport. Clear copper pour with a nice, thick head. Tart aroma with a punch of hops. Thick, grapefruit taste with a nice hoppy finish. A really good IPA.

Fat Heads Head Hunter IPA is good but just not as special as the rankings lead you to believe. Nice amber pour with a tight white head. Aroma is fresh hops with some citrus quality. Taste is fresh hops again with that citrus character but with piney finish that is a little too bitter. Head Hunter is good but just doesnt rate exceptional to me.

Bottle from a local swap, thanks Jeff! Man this is good. A big, grapefruit and grassy aroma. Assertively bitter, with some floral complexity. Reminds me of Heady Topper in most ways. Similar flavors, perhaps not quite as full bodied and well-rounded, but just about as good.
Aroma is of citrus caramel malts and a slight pine. Flavor is rich with citrus and pine with a nice bitterness that lasts but feels well balanced

Poured from bottle to glass. Golden hue with fizzy white head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is orange, melon, pine, citrus oil, grassy, straw. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium body and zesty carbonation. Taste is sweet initially with a nice bitterness that extends into the finish. Overall this is a nice IPA.

Strong pine hop aroma. Gold, clear appearance with a white head. Flavor is full of piney hops and slight caramel. Bitterness is clean. Body is medium light and carbonation is medium. Overall it's a great tasting clean ipa. If you enjoy piney hops you will enjoy this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Not really a piney hop ipa fan, but I do have to say this one is enjoyable. Not good enough that I would buy it again but I can finish a bottle at the least 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at modica, golden orange very nice pour with hoppy pineapple aroma and flavors, has a bit of an edge on the finish but very nice overall
Pours clear dark golden color with off white head. Big pine and citrus aromas. Pine resin and bitter grapefruit flavors with a hint of malt. Medium body with average carbonation. Good stuff.
Love this. Lots of hops but west coast citrus makes it not too bitter. 87 ibu and only 7.5abv is pretty impressive. Hop heads will love it too but definitely not a starter for newbies.
Tap. Deep golden with small head. Nice citrus hops with quite a bit of grapefruit. Moderate bitterness. Very solid IPA with great fruit flavors and hops.

This is so good..like nuts good. The aroma blew me away. I immediately got tons of like white grape juice. I have no clue why but white grape juice just hit me in the face. Then some peach and pineapple juice. Different than most of the IPAs I have. Taste is perfect. Just super fresh like fruit juice with some intense bitterness just awesome stuff, highly recommend it.

12 oz bottle at Gateway Grill in Monroeville, PA. Orange-gold with a small but very sturdy white head. The aroma is all resun and pineapple. The flavour brings more diverse citrus notes, such as mandarin, to go with the aforementioned flavours. Theflavour is big and hits you iimmediately. The hopping is done to perfestion, with the bitterness hitting right after the flavours have established themselves, and lingering through the finish. There is enough malt to keep the hps from being overwhelming. A very well constructed beer.

Bottle, from my Summer Secret Santa. Golden pour with a slushy looking white head. Smells really good, lots of piney hops. A great beer I didnt know existed until yesterday. Thanks to my Secret Santa!
Bottle. Clear amber color with ivory head. Pine, grapefruit, tea leaf aromas. Medium bodied. Sharp pine, tea leaf hoppy bitter flavors with a dusty malt base___desert dry finish---not bad.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Solid IPA. Smell was amazing. Weak pour little to none head retention. Pretty strait forward west coast style though IMHO not very layered. A little one dimensional but a good IPA nonetheless 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow! Hop-tastic right out of the bottle! I couldnt even pour this before I was hit with the amazing freshness of this offering from Fat Heads. Once I did get this into the glass, I saw a light amber, clear, and with a light, white head. The foam did not linger long, and laced lazy and delicately down the sides of the glass.
Im here to tell you that I love Simcoe. I just am a huge fan and theres not much Ill be able to do about it. Okay...moving on.
Im enjoying the tropical fruits involved in the resin right now, the medium body has just enough life to keep my tongue wanting more, the bitter is one of those pleasant things that just reminds you of your last quaff and encourages you to have another.

All in all this has been a bad day, but a fantastic end to it. If given another opportunity to enjoy this presentation again, I certainly will do just that.

This is your quintessential hop smack in the face, glad we stopped here for food and the beer. This was fresh off the tap with nothing but hop stank in your face. Went great with the buffalo calamari.

Tasted on 7/3/14 from a capped 12oz bottle, thanks to Alex for this one. Pours slightly hazy orange amber with a thick , rocky white head that slowly recedes to thick, messy lace. The nose is fairly malt forward with plenty of hop forward resin, herbal notes, grass, and citrus. The flavor is very hop forward with tons of citrus peel, resin, and grass, with a bit more malt than some IPAs, but just enough to balance at the same time. The body is medium with a somewhat sticky texture, average carbonation and a long balanced hoppy bitter citrus peel hops finish.

Theres a reason thus IPA is rated the way it is. Its got a super hop forward aroma with citrus and tropical fruit nose and a great flavor of light mango and plenty of bitterness but not overdone. I dig it and could drink it very regularly with a smile. Well done guys, all around.

Pours light orange with a huge citrus hop aroma. Lots of grapefruit, citrus and pine in the body that finishes clean and dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance was clear orange gold with creamy diminishing white 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are soft pale, crystal sweet malts with citrus, pine and musk, no alcohol. Taste are grapefruit, orange and lemon blast upfront with slight malt sweet middle. Tangy resin and pine backend with no alcohol. Palate was soft smooth CO2 with medium body, then a citrus and piney balanced lasting finish. A wonderful IPA, a touch to much pine though for me.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2014 12 oz bottle. Beer from Total Wine @ Naples, FL. Tasted on 6/17/14. The beer has a strong pine, citrus & some resin scents. The taste is more bitter than some IPAs & still has a good balance. Overall I would buy again. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice, crisp hoppy nose and doesnt disappoint on flavor. A big hit of what seem like cascade hops with maybe some Simcoe. Long finish that does turn a bit musty, not its best attribute. Light medium body leaves a slick, almost oily feel, but thats not bad. Flavor doesnt fade halfway through a glass like many do. Good stuff and a bit of a surprise since I couldnt find it on Rate originally.

Bottle via trade. Medium gold pour with some burnt orange highlights. Pillowy white head. Gorgeous looking. Big wallop of pacific northwest hops on the nose. Loads of simcoe character. Dirty flower bed, some shaved lemon peel and notes of tropical passionfruit. The taste is similar. Earthy hops. Pine cone, bright and resinous bitterness. Dirt and grass cuttings. Medium body, active carbonation. Really dialed-in. An excellent IPA.
Piney aroma with some grapes. Dark gold with huge lacing. This one is all about the bitterness. Massive massive amount of bitterness. Might be one of the most bitter IPA´s I´ve had. Good stuff.

12 oz bottle bought at Capones. Pours a clear orange in color with a finger of white head that leaves a small amount of lacing. Aroma has a pleasant citrus scent, along with some floral and tropical fruit notes. Flavor is fresh hop presence throughout. Finishes with a tangy bitterness and lingers on the palate. Alcohol is very well masked. Delicious.
Nice overall - just a good example of a really well done west coast style. Resin on the finish, a bit fruity in the mouthfeel, and definitely some pine in there too.

Super resin aroma of what Im guessing is Simcoe and Cascade. About as much hop aroma as you could ever squeeze in to a beer. Slight woody and earthy smell. 

Slight off-white head that lingers for a few minutes and dissipates to a slight white film over the beer.

The taste of the beer is surprisingly balanced considering the hop-heavy aroma. Although the beer is very much hop forward. A sticky hop flavor that lingers on your tongue for quite a while.

Received from Local Swap with awlcordell -- Poured into my brand new Prairie Dino glass. Pours a clear golden with quickly dissipating two finger head. Great aroma, bitter forward beer. Pretty solid malt base, definitely a bitter hop IPA not a flavor first IPA.
On tap at Mad Mex. Poured light orange with ok white head. Nice aroma of citrus but not overpowering. Light carb med bod. Light bitter resin taste. Balanced and easy to drink.

Bottle thanks to artmcd8. Pours an opaque golden amber color with a creamy one finger white head. Aroma is sweet tangerines, grapefruit, pine resin, honey, apple, and pineapple. Aroma is really on point with this one. Flavor is big hops on the front end, coating your palate in a bitter spiciness. There are some sweet citrus flavors peaking through but the hop flavors really stand at the front of this one. Finish is dry with a hint of spice. Overall a very nice IPA. Surprised I havent heard more about this one.
Light orange pour, head fades quickly. Aroma of lychee, orange, apricot. Flavor is lightly hoppy, citrus rind, grapefruit.

This beer is a nice "west coast" IPA. This is lot like Stone IPA, it is a bit thinner in mouth feel and you can taste and smell the harsher nature of the Simcoe, but it is still very reminiscent of Stone. Even a bit more dry and bitter on the finish. This is good, but nothing new.

Pours orange and a bit cludy with a foamy white head and plenty of sticky lacing. Aroma was a bit dank and very citrus hop forward. Taste was citrus all around and pretty bitter throughout. I didnt get much sweetness, pretty much bitter from start to end, but darn good.

Just a ridiculously tropical west coast ipa. Smells wonderful. Putting the big dogs to a test right here in Ohio! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle - 12 oz) Cloudy orange pour with a big white head. Huge hop and citrus aroma. Flavor is a massive hop and citrus bomb. Lots of bitterness that lingers for a while with a very sweet and resiny citrus finish. I can see why this won awards. Really damn good.
12oz bottle thanks to Bytemesis! Fat Heads liquid goodness! Straight up delicious IPA. I could drink this one all day.

Tap: clear copper with a fairly sustained white head and lots of carbonation. Peppery, hoppy aroma with notes of celery and something flat with a hint of citrus. Super hoppy with a blunt grapefruit rind aftertaste. A little mustiness in the aftertaste.

Bottle courtesy of Falco242. Sweet, bubblegummy aroma that smells more like candy than beer. Doesnt look very good. Murky dark amber with lots of scary looking particalia, virtually no head or lace. Flavor is the quintessential west coast IPA. Perfect balance, resiny. One of the better IPAs I can remember. If this was available in my local market I would frequently have it on hand.
UPDATED: APR 30, 2014 Un nez formidable de melon deau et pêche, jai rarement vu ce genre de combinaison. Juteux, résineux et longue finale damertume dansante.

12 oz. bottle, generously given to me by falco242 and consumed on 4-26-14. Scents of grapefruit, pine, lemon, peach, pineapple, cookie, and perfume. Perhaps excessively fruity/floral smell. Pours a hazy gold/brass with a small to moderate amount of beige/taupe head. Dry flavor features elements of pine, tonic water, and lemon. Also Nilla Wafers, peach, and pineapple. There is an artificial fruit taste. Much drier/pinier than the fruit-dominated aroma would suggest. Very soft in the palate. Light to medium body. Some liveliness. Interesting palate because so soft, but, ultimately, I prefer more body and liveliness. Fat Heads Head Hunter IPA is an example of the new bread of soft/floral/fruity IPAs, which simply isnt the preference of this long-time IPA-lover. Its not bad, but its also not particularly good by my reckoning.
Gold with a white head. Tropical fruits, sticky, florals, and sweet. Nice palate, tropical fruits, sweet, bitter, light sticky finish.

From a bottle. Pours almost clear golden amber with a bubbly off white head and some lacing. Smells like strong, sweet hops, caramelized sugar, orange, and bitter grapefruit, light musk. Tastes like musky, dry hops, dry orange, bitter grapefruit. Light nuttiness and caramel.

Bottle. Pours clear golden amber with creamy white head. Aroma is biscuit and cracker malts, light toast and caramel, floral and grassy hops, and some tropical fruit. Flavor is sharp hop bitterness, dry malts, grapefruit esters, and faint caramel; dry, bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation.

4/16/14 $3.79 from CBO. LOVED IT!!! Extremely citrusy bitter IPA that is easy to drink and very refreshing. This will move into my "if I see it, get it" rotation. Very recommended!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2014 Rerate - (which I so seldom do as the software does not designate this in any fashion, and does not show up anywhere) due to a fresh (6/14/14 date) bottle from mdg164, many thanks Marc! Pours orangey gold with little head, some white lacing. Aroma has powerful fresh fruit, heavy citrus and pine. Lusciously fruity with tangy citrus/pine components. Very nice. A fruitier Zombie. Taste is of pineapple, grapefruit and lemon zest - raw citrus - with sprucy pine, some mango and lightly sweet malts in the back. Hugely hop forward. Medium bodied. Finishes quite bitter, but with that fruity sweetness fighting through for almost a bitter-sweet blend. Love that battle! Kudos - this one is excellent, and deserving awards. It IS in Alesmith and Sculpins league. 16.4  Initial rating: bottle from Total Wine in Jenson Beach - only bottle left in the store, I asked ... 2/17/14 bottled on date and nice to have for rating #1050, another line of demarcation. Pours a clear orangey gold with a spongey white head leaving terrific lace. Aroma initially has citrus, pine, more citrus and some fresh fruit. Then later some oniony hops show up, with continued bitterness. Taste explodes with pineapple and grapefruit - quite bitter up front - then calms a bit with some tangy spruce needles, an herbal presence and some other fruits. Medium bodied and very sticky, with a bit of an alcohol factor. Finishes quite bitter, with some sweetness from other fruit. Very hop forward, with virtually no malt presence. Due to the hype, slightly disappointing. A solid, tasty ipa, but likely not a top ten one, and certainly no Alesmith or Sculpin. 5-8-8-4-14 (3.9)

Bottle. Pours murky orange with thin white head that lingers. Sweet hop aroma over mild carbonation. Lemony hop citrus flavors with nice resin finish reasonable complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden color with a hint of amber. Off white head that holds fairly well before fading into a medium collar and wisps of head across the surface. Fair lacing. Aroma is bold citrus (grapefruit and lemon) with some resiny pine and a bit of pineapple. Medium body and high carbonation with a good hop bite. Taste is complex. Grapefruit, pineapple, pine and floral hops all intermingle and compete for attention. The aftertaste is piney, grapefruit in the front. I had this with two weeks from bottling and the flavors were much more pronounced and played better. This was written from a 3.5 week old bottle.

On tap at Hunahpu Day 2014. Peachy colour. Aroma is classic IPA smell - hops. Taste is resinous bitterness, hops - bit one noteish and not particularly likeable. Finish is bite. Not a favourite but not awful.

Solid ipa. Typical west coast flavors profile. Very easy to drink. Would love to get my hands on some more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home, courtesy of alexsdad06. Big thanks, Brad! Pours a copper appearance with a nice, cream colored head. Plenty of Northwest hops in the nose. Quite a bit of pine, grapefruit, and juicy citrus from the hops. Pretty malty and strong flavor. Some booze. Moderate to high bitterness. Some cracker and toast from the malt. Pretty juicy. Strong, stiff aromas of pine, fresh, herbal citrus, and a faint whisper of resin rule the roost, with light caramel malts really taking a back seat. Its well-balanced for such a hop-forward beer. Its so delicious in the nose that it almost smells like candy. I dont want to stop smelling it. 

Im not so disappointed that I had to stop smelling it to take a drink, though, because the beer is freaking awesomer in the mouth. Those sticky, fresh, potent, almost candy-like sweet and resinous, piney hops pummel the taste buds as soon as you open your mouth. This is so generously hopped, and the relative thin and non-competing malt body doesnt get in the way. In fact, its very complimentary. The flavor, as is the aroma, is also addictive. Although a good amount of bitterness rears its head in the finish, its extremely tolerable for the amount of hops flavor that it showcases. And man, that bitterness is addictive. Okay, Ohio, Im getting pretty fucking tired of all the electrical tape I have to personally peel off with a boning knife on your bottles. Drsilverworm supplied - thanks! It pours an intriguing orange/copper.tone with a fluffy, thin off-white head. Even before pouring I knew this was an extremely aromatic beer; I finally mananged to tear its cap off and I immediately nosed grass trimmings, grapefruit zest, pine, lactose, yeast (brief), honey, flower pedals and citrus. Im getting excited just by smelling it! Oh, yeah, this is good. Starts out bittersweet with notes of seeds, coriander, and pretzels. From there it adds on maltiness, blood orange, booze, hops and yeast. By swallow the bitterness of the hops is high and full in command. Serving Type: Bottle. 1 1/2 months old. Nice deep golden orange, decent 1-2 finger head, nice and clear. Smells of wonderful, traditional West Coast hops. Lots of great cascade and simcoe coming through in the aroma, with bursts of citrus and tropical notes paving the way. Flavor follows suit - lots of great pineapple, mango, grapefruit, and even piney/resinous flavors make an appearance. Malt backbone definitely present, but doesnt make it too sweet or overtake the hop character. Biscuity, and even some caramel-like malt notes play nice support roles. Hop bitterness explodes and continues to increase over a few seconds as you swallow the beer. Quite surprising level of bitterness for only 77 IBUs! Finishes nice on the palate. Not quite as dry as a true "west-coast" style IPA, but definitely not as sweet and somewhat malt-driven like a lot of Midwest/East Coast style IPAs. Good balance. Not prickly or creamy smooth carbonation. Just right in the middle, with a medium-full palate to back up all the tremendous flavors. Overall, Head Hunter IPA is a really nice beer and, quite frankly, was a pleasant surprise for me!
