Excellent retention. Widely spaced, webby lacing. Nose is soft butterscotch, lemon detergent (volatile), thick orange gummies. Taste is super rich butterscotch, restrained orange and grapefruit peel, mild pine sap, maple, sweet orange syrup. Palate is very bitter, nutty, some walnut/Brazil nut, mild spruce tips. Very rich, quenching, fairly aggressive. 10/2/2012 7/4/8/5/15=3.9355mL second mega fresh bottle from Dan. Lets try this again. Pours with a better, rockier, sheen, buttermilk head. Big retention and better, complete lacing. Nose has no off flavors, more peaches and cream, pineapple, vanilla. Taste is very West Coast in profile reminding me of Sculpin and Alesmith IPA up front, but finishing much more aggressively bitter with mega spruce tip and pine sap. Delicious. Palate is a bit too sharply bitter moving to slight sawdust. The aroma is quite inviting. Very nice stuff. Easy to love. Glad I got some extra bottles. 10/3/2012 8/4/8/3/16=3.9

Bottle from my neighbor Bob - thanks!  Probably the best IPA Ive had in a long time and certainly worthy of the praise afforded from other sources.  The creamy finish goes down well and nicely balances the citrus aftertaste.  No hop bite here.

Enjoyed in a snifter. Pours a cloudy dark orange with a 4 finger pillowy white head. Dominant nose of Simcoe and Cascade. Very piney on the nose. Taste is pretty chewy. This is a DIPA not an IPA. It has a solid malt back bone, lots of piney cone and pine resin taste. Pretty sweet and still quite drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2012 Bottle thnks to beerman6686, Thanks Dan!  Pour is clear amber with a small white head.  Aroma is citrus hop burst with a hint of pine hop and caramel malt.  The aroma is big and clean with with grapefruit and pineapple notes dominating.  Flavor is clean and slightly spicy up front. Some black pepper noted first. Next, clean citrus hop notes with hints of pine hops come though. The malt is subtle but more prevalent in the finish. Not much sweetness at all. More of a dry biscuit malt. Overall, the palate and the flavor profile is more subtle than the aroma led me to believe. Easy to drink.

Poured from a growler.

Appearance: golden yellow-orange color with a finger offsite off-white, thick head. The color is beautiful. Quite a bit of retainment for an IPA.

Smell: strong pine and citrus smell, maybe a little too strong actually.

Taste: unrealistically good taste. Great hops flavor, mild alcoholic kick.

Mouthfeel: a little carbonated, probably because of the serving type. A bit dry, but it goes down smooth.

Overall: without a doubt the best single IPA Ive ever had. Incredible taste. I will be disappointed when the growler is empty.

Thanks Huhzubendah!  

Pours a dark golden color with a thin off white head.  Aroma is fairly mild with slight hops present.  Taste ratchets up the hops quite a bit.  Pineapple, pine, and grapefruit all present.  Feel is fairly bitter, with a balance of fruit in the aftertaste.  Overall, a good example of a west coast IPA...   

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

On tap at Tremont Tap House.  Copper with head and lace.  Grapefruit citrus pine aroma.  Mild peach apricot fruity sweetness mild biscuit very dry clean grapefruity citrus assertive finish.  Excellent.

12oz bottle. Rating #171. Decent beer overall, great aroma, pineapple and a nice tropical mix as well. Flavor was decent, pretty bitter, not as much of that pineapple I liked so much with the aroma, but it may of had a little age on it, flavor just seemed to miss a little something to me. (2473)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text:
This is a very good beer.  Very hoppy up front.  A fantastic IPA that everyone should try!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: FEB 28, 2013 This is a great IPA. Very fruity aroma with a grapefruit taste. Not too bitter.

In a trade from Barak316, thanks for the advice on this one!!!!
 Pours a golden orange with minimal white head. Terrific tracing. AWESOME IPA with great hop flavor but is well balanced. One of the best I have ever had.

@ Fat Heads in Pittsburgh,PA .. deep gold .. medium foam .. deep flower sap .. clean as silk mouth .. . lots going on in this one, very tasty stuff!

.. . . your mother is some kind of ape women??

12 oz bottle.  Almost clear rusty orange with an ivory head.  Nose is orange, caramel and catty hops.  Body is quite chewy oozing resin; dense with residual stickiness.  Taste is dried pineapple, citrus peel and grapefruit juice.  As advertised this stuff is as dank as good Cali bud.

I stumbled across Fat Heads during a business trip in Cleveland a couple years ago; Im a Michigan native.  I tried this beer first, and I was completely blown to find a world-class IPA being produced by a brewery that up until that point, I hadnt heard of.  I have been singing their praises ever since.

Now that it is available in bottles, I was fortunate to get my hands on it once again.  Everything about this West-coast style IPA is top notch.  Intense pine and fruit aroma, and the taste is enough to stimulate the palate of even the most grizzled IPA veterans.  A must try.
tap at fat heads. pours hazy light orange with fantastic white head. big pine and citrus aroma. taste is semi dry great citrus slight bitter finish

Pours clear golden honey/lt amber with a medium white head...bright with decent lacing and retention.  Aroma has lots of grapefruit and some mild hoppy spice.  Flavor is more piney...still a bit of grapefruit and spice.  Mouthfeel is light/medium with a dry piney bitter finish.

Aroma- hops, citrus, floral aromas, some funk
Appearance- light orange/yellow, with a nice white head and incredible lacing
Taste- fruit juices, tropical fruits, massive hops, super dry finish
Palate- nice mouthfeel on this one
Overall- Nice single IPA here.  Very hoppy and very West Coast, a cool one to try.
Bottle courtesy of Dan, thank you sir!  Clear amber color, large solid cream colored head and lacing.  Aroma of citrus > pine.  Taste is bitter pine resin.
Amber pour 1 finger head loada of lace.  Grapefruit mango pine in aroma.  Slightly earthy with big citrus fruit, ripe mango, balanced with honey sweet malt.  Medium body.  On tap at fatheads.

GTMW.  Amber-orange pour.  Nose is big piney grapefruit and mango.  Ultra clean and fresh grapefruity pine and woody herbal hop bitterness.  Solid malt backing helps this to not be too dry on the finish.  An excellent IPA.

Clear pale ambers with nice white head excellent lacing... Huge grapefruit aroma, light pale malt... Fresh grapefruit stone fruit flavor lightly bitter dry finish... Fairly lively... Excellent, up there with the best...

Squat bottle.  Pours hazy deep golden with 3-finger off-white head that laces copiously.  Nose is huge tropical fruit including tangerine, mango, melon, and black pepper.  Tastes caramel malty, but the hops are the highlight; a resiny, mangoey, tangeriney, black peppery hop bite that kicks in at mid-palate.  The Simcoe hops take center stage here, with the others rounding them out.  This is a very good IPA.

Growler shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike!

The beer appears transparent and orange in color with a finger of white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass.

The aroma has a pleasant citrus scent, along with some floral and tropical fruit notes.

Very tasty stuff. Really easy to drink, Fresh hop presence throughout, with various flavors melding together nicely. The beer finishes with a tangy bitterness and lingers on the palate. Alcohol presence is muted, but this beer will sneak up on you if youre not careful. I would happily drink this again.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 03-12-2011
Right now at Mad mex.on draft.  Nice frothy head, nice layered lacing, golden color with nice fragrance and woderful aromatic medicinal hops.
120z bottle, another great beer for hop heads.  Again, this beer is worth going out of your way--excellent ipa

Great IPA!  Very hoppy aroma.  Body is fairly light, alcohol not noticeable, esp. for a 7.5% beer.  Tropical fruit-like hop character, some medium crystal malt.  Bitter, but not too.  No discernible yeast character.  Enjoyable--you will want another!

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2013 An onslaught of luscious tastes sail over my taste buds. This West Coast child sports sappy resin, strong bitter grapefruit as suggested in the nose, and a strong bitter aftertaste that leaves behind a solid dry spot, calling for another sip. Citrus fruits of orange and pineapple sneak in with repeated sips. Very hoppy but wont repel the tongue with an overeager attack. A complex yet simple, straightforwardly enjoyable IPA.

12oz bottle thanks to pellegjr - thanks man! Pours copper orange with thin bright white head. Aroma is a full-on assault of tropical fruit: pineapple, grapefruit, mango, sweet mandarins - wonderful. Lots of pine resin in there too. Taste is a delicious mix of pine, grapefruit, and pineapple - pure hop hedonism. Light caramel malt notes in the background; fantastic dryness in the finish, great lasting bitterness. Cracker of an IPA.

12 oz. Bottle. Floral perfume grass scent. Deep copper, light amber pour with a big foamy head. Medium silky feel with a dry fizz finish. Floral hop fronted taste , slight caramel malt, acidic, bitter grass finish.

12 oz. bottle currently, multiple drafts at Pittsburgh location previously.  Poured hazy orange with white head.  Tons of lacing and fine sediment floating in glass.  Nose is grassy with floral notes.  Juicy citrus fruit flavor at first, backed by a resinous, piney, moderately bitter finish.  Medium bodied.  A real solid IPA, and dare I say sessionable?  Very pleased to see that production of this one has been ramped up.

Bottle, c/o Summer Secret Santa 2012 (alexsdad06).  Pours clear coppery orange with a 2-finger creamy beige head.  Huge mango and papaya aroma, with sweet pine sap and citrus rind.  Incredibly fresh, sweet hops.  The flavor is sweet fresh-cut pine, spruce, and citrus rind (orange, grapefruit).  Aggressive citrus and pine finish.  Medium carbonation and body, a bit warming, and very drinkable.  Very damn good.  Thanks!  [1097]

Bright orange color with small white head and messy lacing. Aroma and Flavor are huuuge, fruity, citric, and floral!.  Lotsa sweetness, not alotta bitterness make this really drinkable and really delicious!

12 ounce bottle poured an amber orange color, with aromas of pine, grapefruit, citrus, and light caramel.  Flavors of citrus, pine and grapefruit, a touch of bitterness in the aftertaste, but iit made me want more.  Really nice IPA overall.

Bottle, pours clean copper w/ frothy off-white head, massive and wonderful resiny grapefruit aroma, clean lightly nutty malt up front w/ whopping resiny bitterness that hits like a freight train  on finish, light and juicy with a dry finish, world class IPA

Aggressive IPA that is perfectly hopped to let the favors and notes to come perfectly to life! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce bottle.  Served in a pint glass, the beer pours a clear orange/amber color with about an inch off-white head.  Head retention and lacing are both good.  Aroma is mostly pine and citrusy (grapefruit, citrus peel, tropical fruit) hops, along with a little bit of caramel malt.  I think the taste follows the aroma, it tastes mostly like pine and citrusy hops, with a teeny bit of caramel malt noticeable.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its creamy and oily with a moderate amount of carbonation.  Its nice to see this brew in bottles, Ive heard about it for a while now but finally was able to try it today and it didnt disappoint!  Its certainly one of the best Ohio IPAs (and IPAs in general) along with White Rajah and Columbus IPA.  Definitely worth trying if you have a chance to get it!

Sample on tap. Mildly hazy yellow orange color. Thin off-white head, leaving even lace. Grapefruit, pine aroma - the hops are big here. Light smooth carbonation, very big finish. Good lace, dry texture. Nice bitter taste. Good stuff, deserves another rate.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a clear bright orange amber color with a medium sized white head.  The nose is big citrus and pine hops, some more dank hops as well.  The initial burst was even a touch tropical. Im sure there is some malt, but who really cares right now.  The flavor has a base of some toasted bread, but again bring on the hops.  There is citrus, pine, resin, grass with a lingering bitterness that has me looking forward to the next drink.  This is the every day drinker I have been looking for and I cant wait until they are a regular on our shelves.

Bottle to pint. Looks decent; orange with good carbonation. Not much head or lacing though. Smells good; a pleasant assortment of hops. Tastes good; much like it smells with a good mouthfeel. Good beer!

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2013 Poured on draft. Copper color with a crisp, sticky white head of foam. Aroma is huge citrus, pine, and resin with a balancing dose of light malt. Semi-sweet taste with a quickly turning move to bitterness somewhere around the first quarter of the taste and so on to the finish. Juicy citrusy finish.

Cloudy orange.  Smalle head.  Draft.  Huge fresh citrus/floral aromas.  Heavy bitter taste.  Pretty smooth texture, just slightly oily.  This is a hop bomb.  Just a very slight malt undertone.  Pretty good.  Wonderful aroma.
Pours a hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of extreme piney citrus hops. Dry smokey bitter and citrus. Finish lingers with a peppery bite. Hop heads dream.
On tap at Fat Heads - Golden cloudy color with a medium head and a LOT of lacing. Strong citrus nose and a heavy (strong again) grapefruit taste. Thin mouthfeel and dry on the finish. Excellent!

A huge thanks to Cliff for this growler. As soon as I cracked the lid, a bouquet of citrusy hops filled the room. The balance in the flavor is great, bready malts, citrus/pine/resin hops. A great beer. Thanks Cliff!

Growler from fatknitty. Huge hop nose, hell yeah. Big dank and citrus, light malt backbone. Crackers and grain. Light, love it. Assertive as fuck. Pours bright golden, great frothy lasting head and lace. The flavor is big and danky, chewy citrus pith and pine, light bread and crackers malt backbone. Dry resiny chewy finish. Lingering hoppy burps. Fucking solid stuff. Would drink all the time.

Growler at home thanks to miketd. What a killer IPA this one is! Served the day after I got it, from my Minneapolis Town Hall Glass. Pours clear orange, thick cream head, great lacing. Nose is fantastic: Many-layered citrus, spice, tropical fruit, big pine and spruce notes, just so close to being perfect... Flavours of bitter grapefruit, very spritzy/juicy, which is just how I like it. Possibly the best IPA Ive had to-date.

On tap at the brewpub not long ago.  Extremely good, and very well balanced, definitely not overpowering.  To be honest, I wish I remembered more about it, this is more of a tick than anything at this point.

16oz draft on tap at the Pittsburgh location.  Pours a crystal clear, bright orange with one ring of head that faded very fast.  Nice, punchy nose, scallions, pine, grapefruit, lemons, earthy, onions.  Flavor was similar, bright citrus, pungent garlic, hop leaves, resinous, a little malt sweetness rounding it out.  Reminded me of a slightly less tight version of Pliny.  Medium bodied, big, zesty finish.  Solid beer.
UPDATED: SEP 7, 2012 Thus might be the best IPA Ive ever had.  Citrus/pine on the nose.  Quite effervescent.  Golden in color.  Totally drinkable and delicious.  Wow.

From a growler from Fat Heads, shared by someone who i dont currently remember. Poured a clear golden orange color with a huge foamy white head. The aroma is heavy on the pine hop character with a decent amount of citrus. Flavor and body is crisp, pine, citrus notes. Very tasty!

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2012 Tap at brewpub. This beer rocks. Pliny the Elder for those who cannot find Pliny the Elder. Strong grapefruit in the aroma and taste from the Simcoe hops. Wonderful pour with a solid but not overpowering head. It is a shame that this beer is not more widely available, because it is truly wonderful. 

Re-reviewed based on a fresh bottle as a trade extra. Cant possibly be as good as my previous review, can it? It IS! The aroma hits you over the head from the moment the bottle is opened. The flavor is all hoppy grapefruit and citrus. My hands down favorite IPA.

Did you expect anything less than perfection? This IPA is a medal winner at GABF with great reason. The color is spot on, the nose is entrancing, the taste is to die for and you can keep sipping on it for quite some time. Doesnt get better than that! If only it were truly sessionable, but at 7.5% youre going to have to show some restraint and keep to a few of these. This is THE benchmark beer for me!

On tap at Fat Heads, Pittsburgh. Brilliant hop aroma, fresh and juicy with floral and fruity notes. Mild pale malt sweetness and carbonic acidity. Medium amber-golden clear, with off-white foamy lacing head. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Pale malt sweetness with a bit of caramel, aggressive hop flavor with fruity notes and a big bitter finish and bitter after.

Bottle from miked. Pours amber with a dissipating white head. Bold floral hop aroma. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Toffee esque malt backbone, but with a huge grapefruit and pine bitterness. Long dry and hoppy finish. Great IPA.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 Tap at Fat Heads. Holy crap - this is an IPA! Light pale yellow / gold pour with a small white head. Huge nose of citrus, floral, and pine. Taste is the same. Frickin awesome!

Had this on tap before and in bottle once, but this is coming from a recent bottle, courtesy of miketd.  Pours clear gold/orange with quickly dissipating white head.  Aroma full of dank hops, some cat piss in there.  Taste brings aggressive bitterness and grapefruity hops.  Man, this is how you make an IPA.  Palate is medium and lively.  Crazy lingering bitterness in the finish.  I can see why Mike says he can drink this stuff all the time.  I wish I had more of this in my life.

on Tap at Fat Heads CLE, several times, they try to keep this on tap every couple of weeks. Its a nice orange color with huge hop nose, the simcoe to me really stands out, and the pine kind of takes a back seat here, which to me makes this more enjoyable. gotta have it fresh though.

(Growler)  Pours a clear golden orange body with a medium white head.  Aroma of biscuit, grapefruit, weed, Peeps candies, and light mint leaves.  Flavor of grapefruit, orange, light pine, peach, and caramel with a dry, bitter finish.

A gift from Nate (ney7039). Thanks man. This is such a fantastic beer. God..now I have to get more Fat Head brews. Super aroma. Pine. Grapefruit. Angel farts. Pours a beautiful gold. Crystal clear. White head. Tastes resin and is bitter but not overwhelming. The bottle says 87 IBU. Big body. Big resin. Lingering dryness. Fantastic.

GABF 2011 Media Luncheon.  Small white head atop a brilliant color of light amber/dark gold.  Big floral citric hop aroma, dank and resinous and big,  Big body, with a long linger and noticeable alcoholic impact.  Very low on malty sweetness, focusing all attention on the floral and citric hops, with a background of spicy bitterness.  Imbalanced, but still tasty.
If youre a hophead, this is the BOMB!!!!!!!

On tap at GABF 2011. Pours a clear orange color with a medium white head. The aroma is rich Simcoe; resinous with pine and grapefruit. A very good flavor; rich resin, bitter throughout, pine and some orange peel. Damn good. Packs a real punch in a world of punch-less IPAs.

Bottle via Mike earlier this year.  (From notes in my beer journal) Pours a golden orange with a slightly off white head that retains a nice amount of head.  Aroma is of sweet hops and pine.  Taste is surprising for a mid-west IPA.  No malt character comes out.  I love this beer.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle, purchased by a buddy who recently went to Pittsburgh. Pours a clear light copper with a fading white head. Intense dank/tropical fruit hop nose. Flavor is just blasting and oozing with piney, fruity, ciitrusy hop goodness - light malt base with a slight tinge of biscuit. Classic PacNW level of lingering resinous bitterness. Medium bodied on the palate with moderate carbonation. Probably the best IPA I have had in the past couple years or so.

Bottle pours bright orange medium frothy white head.  Aroma jumps out of the class with big citrus and pine.  Flavor is big toast and nutty malt with massive herbal dank bitterness.  Slight metallic notes as well.  Outstanding.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 Growler This beer rocks! Pours hazy and golden with a large, foamy, white head. Great retention. The wonderful aroma is just bursting-at-the-seams with freshly sliced fuzzy fruits  peach and apricot  probably a little grapefruit too. Medium-bodied with vibrant carbonation. Although Im not a big hophead, the flavor is quite nice. Tons of fruity lupulin flavor up front, then the bitterness really kicks in. Thoughtful hop bill and schedule. I normally dont like IPAs much, but this one is so very savory, and the bitterness isnt overbearing or offensive. Lengthy, crisp, medium bitter finish.  Kudos to miketd for shipping this 64 oz growler of world class beer my way! I drank the whole thing myself as my wife (a total hophead) was a bit under-the-weather and this brew was just too good to let oxidize in the fridge for even a day.

In short: A wonderful citrusy/tropical IPA
How: Growler shared at RBSG 2011 grand tasting
The look: Clear shinning light-golden body topped by persitent small white head
In long: Nose is an explosion of citrusy/tropical hops with apricots, peaches, grapefruits, etc.  A solid malt pale malts backbone that provides body but only adds some crackers and abit of caramel to the flavor elements spectrum.  Citrusy/tropical fruity hops and more citrusy/tropical fruity hops.  Not too resinous, remains refreshing.  My second-to-last RBSG 2011 grand tasting rating.  And do I remember what I did after the tasting?  Of course I dont.  No need to anymore, theres youtube :(

Apparently this batch experimented with a liquid hop extract so its not as potent as other reports. Nice pine sol on the nose. Pours clear yellow from tap with a thin white head. Grapefruit and pinesol on the tongue without much bitterness. Clean finisher. Good version of the style but not as out there as I was expecting.
Brian orange with a frothy head. Fantastic orange and tropical hop aroma. Piney,  plenty bitter, and good malt character. Medium dry bitter finish. Really nice stuff.
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Cloudy yellow/golden - white head. Grape fruits, yeasty, zesty, sweetness, marmelade, fruity, harsh, medium malty. OK.

Growler, RBSG grand tasting.  Small white head, crystal clear apple juice body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, catty/marijuana, light orange/grapefruit.  Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some pine, apricot.  Resinous medium body.

Bottle 12fl.oz.light unclear medium orange yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, caramlel, moderate to heavy hoppy, orange - citrus, grapefruit, pine, resin notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, orange fruity, peel bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110622]

Bottle at Papsø.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and pine needles with notes of citrus.
Fruity flavour of hops, pine needles and grape fruits.
Dry hoppy finish.

cloudy orange, smooth offwhite head.
bitter hoppy aroma, grapefruit, fruit peel.
very bitter flavor,  grapefruity, but also quite some fruitiness and floweryness.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of hops, spices, lemon, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, spices, citrus fruits, caramel, and malt as well as lighter notes of peaches, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Courtesy of Doodler. Pours a hazy golden with an off-white head. Very fresh citrus and pine in the nose. Medium body, a little sweet fruit and a bitter, piney and astringent finish. 220611

Much thanks to whoever brought this growler to RBSG. Pours out a a moderate golden color with not much of a head. Aroma is intense pine, and some citrus, with light malt in there. Taste is tons of resiny pine, citrus and an overall nice bitterness with only slight malt balance. Very tasty IPA.
Crushed at GABF 10.  Now THAT is an IPA.  Huge hop presence kicks you right in the teeth.  Nice malt backbone, but the hops dominate for sure.  Top notch.

Tap sample at FH. Poured clear copper color with a large frothy off-white head that lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy complex resin earthy hop aroma. Medium to full body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy bitter flavor with a moderate to heavy bitter finish of medium to long duration. Very good brew.

Grolwer shared at RBSG 2011. Poured a clear golden/orangebody underneath a small white head. Aroma is super dank, did somebody just find a bag of kind bud while searching a car? Additionally there is some oregano, and loads of yellow grapefruit meat and skins. Medium to fuller bodied that is almost chewy and soft carbonation, hey its a growler fill so go figure. Flavor of citrus, grapefruit, grassy hops and oregno. This is some good good stuff.

Growler generously shared at the RBSG grand tasting. Pours a bright orange. Tropical aroma of peach and grapefruit. Flavor is a great blend of caramel, peach, and perfume. Boozy with a balance of juicy sweetness and bitterness. Really good.
Growler (RBSG). Poured a medium golden color with a small sized off white head. Aromas of pine, floral, with some citrus. Tastes of pine, floral, citrus, and some caramel.
Orange pour with a watery white head and lace. Huge aroma of resiny hops and caramel malt. Sweet caramel, bread, and resiny hops. Medium body with good carbonation. A nicely balanced beer for me.
Growler at RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours gold with a white head. Awesome resinous piney aroma, with some weedy dank notes. The flavor has big resinous pine and pale malts. An awesome IPA.
From growler. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and slight peachy hoppy. Bitter, herbal and dry astringent peachy and grapefruity. Bitter and dry finish.

I have had this on tap at the out-standing brewery and in bottle.  I recommend a trip to the brewery.
The pour is nice orange hued yellow.  A medium white head sits nicely on 
top.  The aroma is sharp sharp pine with mild floral notes.  The flavor is exactly what the aroma promises.  big hop flavor, with sharp pine, mild citrus.  The finish is sharp.
Excellent beer.
Holy hell what a beer! Deep gold pour, white head.  Aroma bursts with fresh yellow grapefruit and some light almond notes.  Flavor is juicy, bitter, grapefruit galore.  Wow!!

This is one of the top IPAs I have enjoyed.  The award winning ale was enjoyed at the brewery in Cleveland on Derby day 2011.  The place was packed on a Saturday night.  I found a seat at the bar and enjoyed this one slowly.  The complex hops flavors of three varieties.  Th citrus and pine nuts were all blended together.  They were balanced with a perfect ABV of 7.5%.  The lacing down the glass and the atmosphere of the brewery was a memorable experience.  The smooth finish leaving you with the bitterness that is IPA alone.

Apr 25, tap @ Flatheads, North Olmsted. Pours clear golden with a small white head leaving some lace. Aroma is piny, citric, cat bin; just excellent hoppyness. Fresh hoppy mouthfeel. Flavor is fruity, piny, citric and soapy. Nice hoppy sweet palate. Finishes with a great piny bitter tart aftetate.

On tap at Fat Heads in Cleveland.

Pours a nice gold to light copper color with a nice white head and a good amount of lacing. Nice retention as well. The nose brought forward a large amount of hops ranging from citrus to floral to tropical. Altogether a really nice package from a mixed back of hops. I cant recall them at the moment, but there was a sign on the wall that seemed to indicate the hops used in this one. The flavor hit the spot as well with a nice hop character coming through as the dominant character and a good, brisk finish. A bit of alcohol in the finish, though not too much. Terribly drinkable. I wish this were available locally and werent quite as high in ABV.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 02-25-2011

Bottle via trade, thanks a ton! Pours slightly hazy orange, thin eggshell white head.  Aroma is big tropical fruit, some orange and pine, resin notes.  Touch of caramel.  Taste is nice oily, resinous, pine and citrus balance.  Lively carb bitters it a bit more, as the carb fades the tastes are even more accentuated.  Nice brew.

12 oz bottle

Freshly bottled at the brewpub I took home a four pack of this and opened one the next day. It compares very favorably to the draft version which isnt much of a surprise considering it comes from the same source. This is a beer that everyone should get a chance to try fresh (much like the Pliny bottles) - dont let it linger or what youll taste will be a shadow of what it is supposed to be.

Aroma / Appearance - A dense head crawls up the sides of the glass protecting a glowing coppery body. Semi-transparent and shimmering in the light it has the hue of a freshly polished penny. Orange peels, lemon zest, fresh Christmas trees on a cold winter day, and pine resin hits the nose without any restraint.

Flavor / Palate - The mouthfeel is thick, chewy, and rich like the filling of a jelly donut. Bright hops tear at the senses with a resiny impression that holds nothing back. Zesty orange rinds follow the first bite before a comfortable hoppy finish. The overall impression is somewhat like a mixture of bitters, Orange Crush, and pine sol.
Yellow-orange, white head.  Aroma of heavy citrus, oranges, spicy hops.  Taste is the same citrusy underneath melding with caramel and an overlay of spicy hops, bitter finish.  Nice.
Wonderfully balanced IPA with a punch in the face hop profile.  I have had this now in both a draft at the brewpub and in a take-away 4 pack of bottles.  Great stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2011 After popping open one of the bottles I brought back from Cleveland, I had to increase the aroma score.  Just an amazing amount of hops contained in this bottle.  Awesome!

On draft at Fat Heads in Cleveland.    I finally got a chance to try this one, been waiting awhile.  Hit the brewpub on the way home after a weekend in Cleveland.  You can tell this beer is extremely fresh.  Its exploding with aromas of citrus and hop resin.  Full flavor as well, with lots of juicy hops... more citrus and pine with what seems to be very little malt.  ( I was also lucky enough to try the cask conditioned version of this was just a tasty with an extremely smooth palate and soft carbonation.)  And to top it off, I was very pleased to find that they had 4-packs available, just bottle 3 days ago! Luckily with family in Cleveland, I always have an excuse to make the trip to restock.

Bottle shared at a recent BA/RB tasting...  Poured clear golden/orange with a decent white head.  Straight hoppy here.  Not bitter or resinous.  Leafy, earthy, honey-like malt sweetness for balance and a vegetable/root quality.

12 oz.  Strong, solid aroma of hops and pine... some light citrus notes that I suspect will come out in the taste.  Taste is solid citrus and pine.  Wonderful.  Not better than Sculpin, but still great.

Poured a clear gold color from the growler with thick white head. It has big citrus, floral hop, and pine aroma. The citrus grapefruit flavor as well as pine come through in the taste. There is a bit of a malt flavor as well. The hops are not as prominent on the palette as they are on the nose. There is a hop bitterness to the beer but I really wish is was a lot more. Overall I solid IPA.

A: The beer pours a clear golden-orange color with a nice big white head and some moderate lacing.

S: Smells really quite nice. Plenty of pine that is very resinous along with a big grapefruit aroma and plenty of citrus in general. Theres a touch of grassy hop smell and not really much malt at all.

T: Unfortunately, the flavor falls off a little bit. Certainly a lot of pine and grapefruit, as well as a solid bitterness. Theres more malt presence on the palate and just a bit of a step backward in terms of the hop intensity.

M: The body is medium with a lively carbonation and a nice dry and slightly bitter finish.

D: I really want to give this beer a better score, but the flavor just let me down after what was a very nice nose.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2012 Bottle and growler from stfun... Nice nose of pine, grapefruit and citrus.. Glowing orange color, decent head.  Lots of pine and grapefruit... Nice bitterness but well balanced. Dry... lots of bitterness and grass in the after taste. Medium body. Overall: A nice little IPA.  HopHeads delight. Thanks josh

I thought this was a very flavorful IPA. I had tried 3 IPAs, Palate Wrecker and a Hopsecutioner and this beer was better than either of those. Great aroma of hops and slight citris. A good thick pour that coated my glass and palate. Very enjoyable.

Bottle as an extra in a trade with tobiasfunke5 over at BA.  Pours a clear orange amber with a medium to large sized creamy white head.  Big resinous citrus hops, pungent and dank, with a clean crisp malt backbone. Medium bodied, smooth and malty, with a big bright citrus hop component. Moves to a tropical fruit and grapefruit bitter finish, lingering with some quinine notes.  Fantastic.

Thanks turdferguson. Pours clean, sharp, and golden with one finger of sticky white head. Nose is awesome. Very rich, clean, and fresh. Grapefruit upfront with some peach and mandarin orange and a hint of resinous pine.  Nice zesty flavor with a rich oily hop character and mildly grassy notes. Not as much delicate character as the aroma but still nice. Very nice body with a resinous hop bitterness and dry finish. Very nice-uh

Draft at Fat Heads
Aroma: Citrus and pine, with a light floral aroma. Lots of hops--very intense and complex.
Appearance: Clear golden orange with a white head that dissipates almost immediately.
Taste: Light sweetness tempering a medium bitterness with a slight sourness in the back. 
Palate: Medium-Full body, Crisp Texture, Lively Carbonation and a long, complex finish.
Overall: This is an extremely well crafted and thought out beer. Its not over the top like some IPAs, but its not meant to be either. Its strong and developed enough to hold its own against the competition. A great beer for one to sip slowly and enjoy the many layers.

Bottle from MikeTD.  Pours orange golden with a thick sudsy white head.  Nose is fresh simcoe, columbus, cascade as advertised-- a little green, but not overly so.  Flavor showcases the hops as well with lots of pine and citrus bitterness throughout, but seems less aggressive than the nose.  Leaves a slightly chalky, green hop bitter flavor in the mouth.  Thanks for the hookup Mike!

Bottle courtesy of Doodler (thanks Scott) poured a clear tarnished gold with a lasting white head. Aromas of biscuit, pine, tangerine, tropical fruit, apricot and light mint. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, earthiness, pine, grapefruit and light tangerine with a smooth dry lingering bitter finish.

Had this beauty in a mug at Fat Heads in Pittsburgh.

Hazy orange color with a healthy creamy white head. Average retention and minimal lacing. Smelled chock full of herbal and floral hops and the woodiness coming from a cask ale. Taste was quite hoppy with a strong oakiness. Very good. Creamy and smooth. Wanted more, but there were others to try.

4.0 A
4.0 S
4.5 T
4.5 M
4.5 D

Serving type: cask

Reviewed on: 09-02-2009 02:50:19

(12 oz bottle) Nice big strong hop aroma starts this beer out.  The beer pours a clear light amber, with a thin white head.  Nice powerful hop blast with a strong pine note.  Theres just enough malts here to balance out the hops.  Glad this one is in a bottle, because it can be a bit too dangerous to go to the bar and drink it by the pint there.  One difference from the tap, the bottle is listed as 87 IBU, and 7.5% ABV.
On tap; poured a orange caramel type color with not much head.  Aroma of Bo, wood, earth, caramel and fruit.  Flavor had alot of earthy and woody hops.  Hop forward.  Some caramel and fruit.  Nice.

Pours lightly hazy, pale orange with a medium white head, good lace. Smells citrusy and grassy with a bit of must. Tastes citrusy and hoppy with some grass and earth notes and a bit of malt presence in the back. Medium body, good carbonation. Bitter finish.
Draft.  Subtle hop aroma. Golden body with thin head, nice lacing.  Citrus and hop flavor is dominate but well balanced.  Hints of grapefruit.  Lingering bitter aftertaste... excellent.

sampled at GTMW 2010...pours a mostly clear apple cider brown with a fluffy off-white head... assertive citrus and floral hop nose... flavors of citrus and biscuity malt. clean hop flavors and went down easy.  adequate body and carbonation.

Many pints at Fat Heads, Pittsburgh.  Pale amber pour.  The nose is incredibly fresh and fruity.  Lots of bright orange peel, soft and fruity with a nice citrusy aroma and a bright blast of hoppy resinousness.  Intensely piny with some lean sweet malts.  Lean pale malt and a bright chewiness.  Fresh and chewy and damn delicious.  This is a great example of why freshness matters with IPA.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2011 Sampled on draft at Fat Heads in Pittsburgh this beer poured a vibrant golden color with a medium sized beige head that lingered and produced some lacing. The aroma was a strong and lovely mix of pine, pineapple and grapefruit with light notes of catbox and perfume. The flavor was tangy and sweet with strong notes of pineapple and pine, moderate grapefruit, and light perfume and catbox. Nicely malty for all the hops. The finish was long, sweet and hoppy. Moderately full bodied. Excellent.

sample from the pitcher @ GABF on 9/18/10.  golden pour with a small white head.  subtle hop nose - perhaps due to the glass.... Ill bump it to an 8.  big aggressive bitter mouthfeel.  medium body with tons of floral hop notes.  bitter finish.  great IPA.
Nose is a minty & dank explosion, lemon, berries.  Flavor is bubblegum hop, mint & dank.  Some caramel backing it up.  I really dig these minty IPAs
aroma- very sweet caramel, spruce, orange citrus.  pours golden with head.  taste is dry citrus hop, pine, tangy on front of tongue with sweet caramel in the middle and dry hop to finish.
From a growler..Thanks Mike!  Awesome grapefruity and pine aromas.  Excellent orange color with a small white head.  Grapefruit, pine and a slight orange flavor.  In a word AWESOME!

Bistro 13th IPA Fest notes.  Good West Coast-style IPA.  I can see why this beer won at last years festival, but it didnt exactly blow me away.  The taste has good bitterness and is relatively dry.  Grapefruit and pine resin dominate the aroma.  Bitter finish.   Feel is a touch rough.  This beer is well-made but sticks to very familiar territory.

On cask at GTMW 2010 - Was looking forward to this one a lot before the fest, and it was a pretty big letdown. Clear yellow pour with a big white foamy head. Huge citrus and pine hops on the nose, with a nice honey maltiness. Taste is tons of pine and tree sap, with lots of sweet malt. Hops are way too dry for my taste, and left a nasty aftertaste in my mouth. Smooth, slick and medium-bodied, it feels good in the mouth, but I didnt want any more than the sample poured into my taster.

Growler. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy piny grapefruit aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor with hints of pine needles. Has a fruity hoppy bitter grapefruit finish.

Light-amber in color, very clear with decent lacing down the glass. Explosive citrus hops aroma. Light-medium bodied, well-carbonated - a little acidic- with a long lasting finish. The flavor is dominated by assertive and bitter citrus hops with a spicey hop finish. A punch to the tastebuds this one is!

Simcoe and Columbus hops really on display here... Aroma very piney and grassy, Cascade definitely overshadowed by the flavor from the Simcoe and Columbus hops, very herbal flavor with a nice dry finish, reminiscent of the West Coast varieties... Well done!

On tap in Pittsburgh.  Pours an orange caramel color with a soapy white head.  Aroma of pine and grapefruit-noticeable and inoffensive.  Flavor of grapefruit, pine, and some hop bitterness.   Very well-balanced.  I was a bit surprised at how good this was!

Sample at the brewpub. This beer is a clear orange color with a medium thin and foamy white head that recedes steadily. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of grapefruit and herbal hops. Medium body with flavors of citrusy hops, caramel malt and a bit of pepper. The finish is moderately hoppy with a lingering grapefruit aftertaste. Solid IPA all around, its easy to see how this won an award.

On tap at Pitts brewpub location.  Pours a golden yellow, with foamy white head.  Grapefruit, citrus, floral hops, light caramel, and balanced grainy malt.  Good IPA, but doesnt quite match up to the west coast offerings... I am spoiled.
Growler, thanks Rciesla for sharing, via MikeTD. Golden orange pour with some white head. Citrusy, pine and grapefruit hop aroma. Pine forward flavor with some citrus notes. Nice.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2013 draft - Pours hazy copper and has a very nice pine and citrus hops aroma.  The flavor is bitter with pleasant pine and underlying citrus notes.  The malt supports it well and its overall a great IPA.
Rerate 8/27/2013, tap - Not as impressed the 2nd time. Still good, but not great. 7/3/7/4/13. Averaged with first rating of 9/3/8/4/16.

Picked up a pine at DLD 2010.  Great citrus piney nose with slight malt in the background.  some malt sweetness and bitterness linger.  Not overwhelmingly strong in flavor just very sessionable and balanced.
on tap-pours a white head and pale yellow/yellow color.  Aroma ispine/citrus-grapefruit.  Taste is dry pine/citrus-grapefruit hops bite, secondary light malt.  Good effervescence.

Growler; thanks Tom!!  Pours clear orange with foamy white head; dank nose of pineapples, mangos and a little pine resin; wow, just a killer fruity nose; light texture with raw white sugar, pine resin, oranges and healthy does of bitterness; more grapefruity bitters in the flavor compared to the pineapples, mango in the nose; minor raw garlic in the finish; great stuff

Small tasting/gathering last night of Seattle Beer Week 2010
Orange in color, clear with a thin head.  Tons of fruity hop and a good malt backing.  This was a tasty treat.  Lots of interesting flavors with the added garlic and the garlic finish.  Thanks MikeTD for bringing this to us.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2010 Fresh growler from Fatheads in Pittsburgh.

A-pours a hazy golden honey color with a pretty tight creamy white head.

S-notes of malt but very faint, lots of hops!  light pine, grassy herbal hops, hints of tangerine and grapefruit in the back.

T-the taste is so hoppy and nice.  virtually no malt, awesome hop presence.  piney up front, notes of caramel and brown sugar maltiness makes its only appearance.  grassy hops in the middle with grapefruit taking over in the back with a nice present bitterness.

M-this is extremely smooth on the palate, nice carbontion holds a lighter medium body, dry in the back with a hint of crispness.

D-this is a huge hop lovers IPA, which I am.  very tasty, nice balance of flavors that work really well together.  by far fatheads best offering!

On tap. Poured a clear pale gold with a white head that laced nicely. Aroma was full of strong hops with a bit of underlying grassy as well. Flavor had a combination of three hop flavors, grass, pine and citrus. The pine was by far the most dominant.

Tap at DLD 2k10.  Pours to a light yellow body with a white head.  The aroma is huge and West Coast styled.  Sweet peaches and bitter grasses.  The flavor is sweet nectarines and bitter pine/grass.  The palate is nicely sweet but still bitter.

This could be the best IPA ever made!
Aroma- Piney/citrus
Appearance - dark/yellow-light brown
Taste - Citrus! Citrus! Citrus!
Body - Not to full just right for the style
Overall - The best IPA I ever had!

growler. thanks mike! pours crystal clear bright orange with a dense and creamy white head and tons of lace. enormous danky tangerine nose with lots of garlic and onion mixed in. creamy medium body with tons of lively carb. toast, caramel, tangerine, garlic and onion on the mid palate. long garlicky finish.

Thanks again MikeTD this was awesome.  Pours  a honey toned body with a light off white head.  Grassy floral hop notes, sweet pine and citrus notes.  An earth maryjane like earthiness.  Green and grass with a dry mid bodied herbal-ness.  Great stuff.

Growler shared by Rciesla at BT>  POurs a nice hazy bright orange copper with a thin lasting sticky white head.  Aroma is mango citrus, light garlic hint, herbal and light grass with some pine notes- very light on the malts just light cracker and slight carapils.  Flavor is also skewed mostly towards citrus and light dank hops with some tropical notes, orange and mango dominate with a grassy fresh floral note and tacky hop bitterness in the end- finish is quite dry.  Very nice IPA!

I have no idea who gave me this but I remember having it. Its not a very fair rating but I recollect this being really good. Enjoyed some where near the port a pissers at DLD. Kinda goldish color, strong aromas of pine and citrus. Hope to try this again sometime to give it a fair and semi realistic rating.

Guest draft on tap at DLD. Pours a solid hazy amber hue, a bit glowing, nice bright white head dies to a solid film, laces ok. Aromas are nice, solid hops with heavy citrusy grapefruit, lemon, a faint orange with a touch of pine, florals, underneath caramel, pale bready malts mix. Initial is medium bodied, heavy hops with more pine and floral, citrusy fruits tangle with pale malts, some decent caramel and toffee. A touch of peppery spice, very hop forward and a great presence on the palate. Finish solid bitterness lingering of pine and florals.

Growler at DLD.  Poured clear medium golden with a short cap of white head.  The aroma picked up juicy floral and pineapple notes over a citrus meat and lesser pale base.. nice and tropical in nature.  The flavor was juicy again with more floral and pineapple notes leading.. grapefruit joined in through the finish.. there was enough maltage to support, and it worked well in the background.  Slick feel on the palate with grainy bitterness on the finish.. smelled and tasted great, but only flowed OK.
Growler sample thanks to SoLan. Golden color with a white head. Nose is citrusy,hops. Palate is full of hops, citrus, bitter with a dry finish. Medium bodied and a very good IPA.

Courtesy miketd. Growler. Orange/gold/copper, white carbonation. Take 2 Hearted and add a touch of west coast juiciness and couple dank nugs and you get this. Medium body, balanced, dry, easy to drink. World class IPA.

Sampled from growler, courtesy SoLan.  Clear golden color, moderately thick white head. Nice strong floral aroma, pine resin.  Taste has a nice clean strong floral taste, no astringency.  A quality IPA.

Glad to see this made it to DLD 2010. Pours hazy dark orange with small off-white head. Aroma was very nice. Loaded with fresh hops, pine, and tons of citrus. Flavor was a bit more mellow than the aroma. Tasted pine, citrus, hops and light caramel. Did not have tongue buckling bitterness I was hoping for. Still a really good IPA overall.

Draft at DLD. Slightly hazed copper with sticky head. Nose is super packed with aroma, resin, pine & cat pee. Really fresh hop nose. Taste is a bit green for my liking, could use some more brash bitterness to balance it out. Still, a really full flavored and aromatic beer. Pretty good stuff.

Tap glass at Dark Lord Day. Aroma of hops was solid resiney and pine,that full rich power sniff that only a few brewmasters seem to nail down. The flavor ws even better,that big rich hop Christmas pine and resin flavor,with a tantalizing caramel sweetness that would almost make it more of a pale ale,had not those hops been so out front. What a great surprise to see it there after a few Ratebeerians tried to talk the owner from bringing it to the event the day of the event,figuring the keg wouldnt be settled yet. Obvious ,no damge was suffered,one of the big highlights of the day

Tap.  Pours a clear amber color with a very large, frothy white head.  Lacing is above average.  Aromas of grapefruit, pine, and citrus dominate due to the ridiculous hops.  Palate is very smooth with a clean, crisp finish.  Bitterness is well balanced throughout and the taste is pure Heaven with the hops.  One of the BEST IPAs I have ever tasted - I truly hope they start bottling this beer soon and shipping it to DC!
Clear copper with a white head, bright citrus hops pine, pale malts. Well balanced, citrusfloral and pine on the finish.

Nectar of the Gods.  My current and possibly all-time favorite.  Aroma is dank, delicious hops. Taste is sublime and cascading; more an experience than a flavor.  Bitterness crests at the point of perfection and then backs away into a crisp finish that leaves you eagerly awaiting the next quaff.

On tap at Pittsburgh location. Pours a slightly hazy light orange with a pretty massive head and an awesome hops-filled nose. Pine needles and grapefuit dominate the aromas and fill the palate while playing of an undercurrent of caramel and tropical mango and papaya. Damn good...  Damn good.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Sample, GLBN IPA Challenge 2010. Big hop aroma * flavor. Agressively bitter, piney, resiny hops. Well balanced. A must try for hop heads. Solid beer

Growler from David + Katie. Pours a clear gold with a nice head with tons of lacing. Huge hoppy dank nose with some tropical fruits, light malts. Citrus hop flavor, some apricot, firm bitterness. A very drinkable west-coast-style single IPA. Very very very nice.

tap at fatheads.  pours a hazy dark ornage with a small creamy white head.  aroma of pine, orange, fruit, and white grapes.   flavor is an earthy, creamy caramel.  body was bigger than expected.   Pretty good.

On cask at Fatheads North Olmsted. The bartender set this beauty down on the bar and I was hit with citrus aroma from three feet away! Taste was perfect citrus from the start, surprisingly different in the middle with a taste I couldnt quite put my finger on and Ive never got in an I.P.A. and finished with a nice soft, relatively mild bitterness. A nice little change for the tired American I.P.A. pallet. Excellent, and worth the pilgrimage to Olmsted or wherever the hell I was. Underrated.

Tap @ Fat Heads.  Pours a slightly hazy dark gold, the small fizzy white head left some spotty lacing.  Nice resiny hop nose with minimal malt interference.  Very hoppy, but very well restrained bitterness, must be heavy on the late addition hops.  Lingering hoppy finish.  Light to medium bodied with fizzy carbonation.  Pretty refreshing.  The cask sample of this was better, a lot more soft and the bitterness was a little more pronounced.

Cask Stillage from the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center 25/09/2009
Pine hop aroma. Golden coloured strong in alcohol and hoppy with a crisp and dry malt finish.

On-tap at Pizza Plant.Cloudy grapefruit with a foaming white head. Lots of lace. Grapefruit aroma. Initially there is a strong hop bite, nay burn, then the mouth gets more used to the acidity. The flavour is pretty good grapefuit. 77IBU.

Sample at the brewpub. Clear copper pour with a medium off-white head. Citrusy orange and pine hop aroma with a touch of malt. Piney and orangy hop flavor with a hint of spice from the simcoe with a piney finish. Best beer of the night and maybe the best of theirs Ive had, but Id have to try it side by side with Hop Juju to crown an official winner.

this was the beer i had a few of while at fat heads- super dank aroma and flavor- that ctz hop was overwhelming and awesome. nice lemony/citrus notes as well- bitter for sure, and got a bit tough in the drinkability department towards the end of the second pint, but nice for sure.

On tap.  Pours a clear deep orangy/golden color.  Awesome citrus/pine aroma.  Hops all the way.  Great hop flavor, but not overly bitter or astringent.  A really nice, but intense hop flavor.  Clean finish with some malty sweetness that mellows out the hop bite.
user_location: The Land of Milk and Honey, Ohio, USA

text: Tasted on tap at the Bistro 12th Annual IPA Festival on 8/8/09. This IPA pours a medium orange gold color from the tap. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is floral and orange. A medium bodied IPA. The malts are fruity and sweet. The hops are floral and citrusy. Nice balance. Nice carbonation. Very solid IPA. Good drinkability. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

Enjoyed via tap at the Pittsburgh pub.  The beer pours a straw-gold to slightly amber color with a nice white head that lasts throughout the beer.  Strong Simcoe hop character comes through in the nose, evidencing some pretty liberal late hopping.  Some other west coast varietals come through as well, but they are muddled by the powerful danky aromas of the aforementioned.  The palate is unapologetically hoppy, giving a bracing bitterness that one would expect in something like a Stone Ruination or other very high IBU offering.  Malt character is minimal, but there is a very slight background sweetness.  Overall, I was skeptical that this would be up to the hype that has been around it in the Pgh area, but it delivers.

On tap at Bocktown. Very different for an IPA. The malt and a weird smokiness were the main flavors here, with the hops barely making a presence. Aroma was good. Light smoke with dark caramel. Pour was a medium brown with a one finger off white head with no bubbles. Taste was all malt. Near maple syrup sweetness with a stale smoke flavor. The hops come in in the aftertaste for just a few seconds. Very weird.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: The aroma was bursting with fresh, flowery hops.  Plenty of juicy citrus and fresh cut pine to please the nose.  Copper body with an amber tint, large cloudy head and plenty of thick lacing.  Medium bodied leaning on the heavy side, malty with a big bitterness.  Drinks clean and nice.  Caramel, nuts, and toast are soon pushed aside as the fresh American hop flavors step up.  Fruity, flowery, and piney.  Wonderful IPA.

Draft at the Bistros IPA Fest. My favorite one and its from OHIO, no less! Iced down in the large suitcase the five gallon keg came in! Nose was floral and piney hops, big time. Clear yellow amber with a medium glass lacing pale yellow head. Flavor was bitter, bitter, and more bitter. Excellent!

Tap at the 09 Bistro IPA Fest in Hayward, CA.  This won the gold medal and for good reason.  I got the last pour from the keg, FOR FREE!  Orangish-amber color with a white head and nice lacing.  Floral and citrusy hops as well as sweet malt on the aroma.  Flavor is sweet caramel malt, light fruits, toffee, and a sharp, fresh grapefruit/pine hop finish.  Smooth on the palate and fairly full with hop oils.  Really good overall.

Tasted at the Bistro IPA fest. Pours a darker shade than most IPAs. Kind of burnt orange with an orange head. The aroma was typical of pine and citrus. The flavor however was very nice. Malt forward with toffee flavors and the hops finishing it out nicely. Very well  balanced and tasty. This one was a surprising winner for me.

On tap at the Bocktown, a really nice palce.  Looks like a typical pale lager.  Quite hoppy and fruity floral aroma. Rude oily mouth coating experience, who put the soap in here? Little if any carbonation. Too much for this lager lover. Lets all chew some green grapefruit rinds and sappy pine needles! Long bitter terrible linger. What can I say but; on style.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2013 7/14/2009:  Fat Heads Head Hunter IPA is chewy, thick, and syrupy.  There is just a ton of Simcoe and sweet tangerine hops pouring out of this beers aroma and flavor.  However, there is also quite a bit of sticky and sugary toffee malt as well.  I am starting not to like all of that sugary maltiness in hoppy beers.  Id rather IPA tend more toward the hops than the malt.  Anyways, this beer has a moderate level of bitterness.  Additional pine hop flavor comes out as the beer warms.  This beer has a medium-full body, a hazy copper-orange color, and a frothy off-white head, solid lacing, and random big carbonation bubbles.  I think quite a few people will really enjoye this beer and it is quite good, but the sugary almost cotton candy like sweetness that comes through at times is just too much for me.  I would rather have pint after pine of the Fat Heads S.P.A... 
Sample (draught; 6.2% abv; 77 ibu) at the Cats Eye in Athens, Ohio during Ohio Brew Week 2009.  Rating #9 for this beer.  Score: 7/3/7/3/14=3.4
. . . . . . . . . .
1/05/2013:  Fat Heads Head Hunter IPA...  Aroma:  Orange and tropical fruits.  Appearance:  Hazy orange colo; dense, bubbly off-white head.  Flavor:  Floral, citrus; medium toffee maltiness.  Palate:  Soft; medium body.  Overall: Good; has a bit more bitterness than the Revolution Anti-Hero IPA.
Draught at Flip Daddys in Mason, Ohio.  Score: 7/4/7/3/15=3.6

Sampled on draught at the brewpub in North Olmstead, OH. Pours to a golden to light amber color with a tight head that fades, and a good carbonation. Big aromas of pine and grapefruit flood the nose. The palate is firm, with good, crisp, pale and biscuity flavor paired with a very nice back drop of lemon/grapefruit and piney hop flavors. This beer ends with with a big smack of zesty citrus and pine bitterness that lingers. Excellent example of AIPA, hops abound in nose, palate, and finish. Really impressive beer, and a great one to pair with a number of dishes on the Fatheads menu.

Refreshing IPA, very pale in color, little head, little lacing. Nose is all citrus & pine, flavor is strongly cascade hops, citrusy and only slightly bitter with a pine bite. Slight caramel malt backbone - Just a lovely thing with their BBQ.

Draft at the brewpub. Clear amber with a big white head and some nice lace. Big grapefruit aroma and resiny pine reflects the hop bill as described by the brewer. The aroma isnt jsut about hops, as there is some toffee and caramel in there as well. Very resinous on the palate as expected, medium body, dry and bitter. Some fruitiness with its attendant sweetness is quickly vanquished by the huge hop presence extending into a long bitter finish. An excellent IPA in the West Coast tradition.

This poured a cloudy bright yellow color with a big white head. Aroma was loaded with strong pine hops, mainly from the simcoes I assume. Flavor was just the same, just a mouthful of pine and citrus flavors. This is a real hop bomb for a regular IPA

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2010 yellow with large white head.  herbal hop nose.  solid bitterness before huge hop herbal and citrus aspect mostly.  some mild low crystal sweetness before a bone dry finish.  great ipa

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2013 [Draft @ Fat Heads] Poured an amber color with a small, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of floral hops, citrus fruits, toasted malts, pine, and light toffee.  Taste of citrus fruits, pine, grapefruit, some vanilla, and toffee, with a bitter, hoppy finish.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2010 Sample at the brewery.  Pour is golden color with off white head.  Aroma is strong pine with some citrus mixed in.  Has a medium mouthfeel.  Flavor is strong pine and citrus hops upfront.  Leads to a nice caramel touch with more pine hops to the finish.  A real hop blast.  My favorite on their list.  This one is for hopheads only.
